description.hltext_display: 面对通胀愈演愈烈政策调控宜早不宜迟
description.author: www.hexun.com
description.content:
等趋势明了后才出台调控政策,最后便容易“踏空”――被迫严厉紧缩
【财新网】(特约作者 陈勇)决策层和市场在玩“猫捉老鼠”游戏。在CPI再创新高之后,加息“靴子”迟迟未落地,市场在焦灼中对货币政策渐渐有些麻木。虽然决策者可以做到出其不意,但如此政策迟缓,最终受打击的还是实体经济。
通胀之火蔓延
我们此前曾提出,现在也存在有利于通胀回落的因素:一,农产品价格上涨具有周期性,这意味着短期物价上涨动能将减弱。分析本世纪以来的农产品价格波动周期可发现,周期性上涨一般持续18-24个月,中国的本轮上涨已经历13个月;二,虽然劳动力成本上升可能成为影响通胀的长期因素,但截至今年三季度的制造业数据表明,工人实际工资增速比去年同期下降,也就是说,劳动力成本没有出现加速上升;三,既然“需求是以货币表达的需要”,货币已经趋势性收紧,M1增速高点出现在2010年1月,从中国的经验数据看,货币(M1)传导至物价(CPI)的滞后期为6-12个月,货币收紧的滞后影响也即将体现为物价回落。
在政策宣示上,政府控通胀的决心显而易见。10月20日加息,近期连续三次上调存款准备金率,同时,政府相关部门还通过行政手段打击投机行为,如果调控力度持续,我们有理由预期通胀之火将逐渐被浇灭。
问题是,雨量不够大,通胀之火仍在延续。如今只闻雷声不见雨,我们担心这种有风的气候条件下,风助火势蔓延。
CPI达年内新高时,央行上调存款准备金率0.5个百分点,一次性冻结资金约3500亿。联系到11月份约3200亿的新增外汇占款和超预期的信贷投放,这一政策动作显得过于“稳健”,只是对冲了11月份的货币超发问题。
加息预期未兑现,负利率进一步扩大。持续负利率是对负债的补贴,强化了“再杠杆”,对通胀形成刺激作用。能负债者,往往是那些财富占有或在资源分配中具有优势的群体,这将恶化收入分配结构。负利率进一步降低无风险收益率,导致风险偏好上升,调控虽然打击某些投机行为,但不能改变资金逐利性,理性的资产配置行为将是减少现金或存款,增加商品和资产,这是负利率刺激通胀的另一个渠道。
升值预期同样形成通胀压力。当名义汇率存在升值压力时,如果汇率被“管理”,升值压力便会通过通胀释放出来,最终导致实际汇率升值。本世纪以来的历次通胀,都与升值预期强化不无相关:从2003-2004年、2006-2008年、以及2010年,都是升值预期先抬头,通胀随即上升。按照当前的升值节奏,至少到2011年上半年,人民币升值预期不会明显弱化,升值压力对通胀压力的传导不容忽视。
政策不确定性
通胀和升值预期在持续,而宏观政策温和且滞后,这是我们判断通胀短期内存在不确定性的主要原因,短期通胀的担忧远大于中期。
11月份价格涨势趋弱的规律已被打破。因为前期涨势过猛,根据我们跟踪的农产品价格数据,预计12月份的物价涨幅将回落。2011年的春节在2月初,1月份价格涨势很可能回升。若不幸遭遇灾害性寒冷天气,CPI有可能再创新高。如此看来,在这一段时间内,如果调控再次加码,可能的工具包括准备金率、汇率、利率和行政手段。
准备金率作为数量调控手段,使用灵活,决策程序相对简单,是央行最易使用的工具。因为存在其他影响货币数量的渠道,准备金率工具的选择需要以下条件:信贷投放超过了正常节奏、贸易顺差和外商直接投资继续处于高位;升值预期和“热钱”流入继续。当其中两个条件成立时,都有理由预期准备金率上调。
行政手段短期直接见效。自10月份起,发改委等部门开始采取一系列措施稳定物价,尽管目前政府像2008年初那样全面、直接管控价格,但是,若灾害性寒冷天气再次侵袭,行政调控可能加码。
利率。政府对动用利率工具可能有两大顾虑:一是2009年以来积累了大量的中长期贷款,提高利率将增加国有企业和地方政府的财务压力;二是外部经济形势仍有不确定性。我们认为,政策往往对基本面呈不对称反应,决策层倾向于夸大负面因素。美欧等发达经济体基本面恶化的可能性正在减弱,增长率低于中国的印度、巴西,甚至匈牙利都已多次加息,他们的外围环境并非好于中国。
如果现在不加息,通胀和负利率如何应对？若以后加息,是否在通胀再创新高之后才行动？若通胀还会创出新高,为何现在不加息？我们认为,加息问题和通胀一样,短期可以看紧一点,中期可以放松一点。
汇率。在我们看来,动用汇率工具有较大确定性。升值压力增加通胀压力,反过来,升值对通胀也有抑制作用。升值可以避免资源进一步向对外部门集中,促进产业升级,从而优化经济结构,还可以缓解管理层的担忧:当外围不确定性增加时,升值压力也扩大,升值替代加息还可以缓解中长期借贷主体的财务压力。不过,升值不能完全替代加息,至少它不能直接解决负利率问题。
按照确定性程度,预计上述工具使用的顺序如下:准备金率、汇率、利率和行政手段。
调控宜早不宜迟
如果以投资做比方,政府算是个天生的“右侧交易者”,等趋势明了后才做操作(出台调控政策),随着趋势深入逐渐加仓(政策加码),最后便容易“踏空”。政府作为市场中的最大主力,在趋势后期出手,容易助涨助跌,加剧经济波动。因此,对于通胀,调控政策宜早不宜迟。
虽然官方利率不变,但市场利率高企,可以想象,大的市场机构都以较高利率融资,中小民营企业、城市工商户和农村经营户的融资成本将更高,这不利于扩大就业。正规金融渠道里的大部分资金,以补贴方式(负利率)配置给财富占有或在资源分配中具有优势的群体,这个群体资金状况并不紧张,这种资源配置方式缺乏效率。
负利率进一步降低无风险收益率,导致风险偏好上升,容易滋生资产价格泡沫。美国次贷危机就是个教训。
政策滞后,调控起来就往往力度很大,因为力度不大不足以抑制趋势的自我强化。所谓过犹不及,严厉紧缩政策的不利后果,中国前期已有两次教训:1998年-2002年的长时间低迷,以及2008年底开始的经济快速下滑。虽然不利后果的出现源于国内外多方面因素,但决策层偏好右侧交易,也是不可忽视的原因。■
作者为华泰联合证券宏观高级研究员、中国社科院金融所博士后
【免责声明】本文仅代表作者本人观点，与和讯网无关。和讯网站对文中陈述、观点判断保持中立，不对所包含内容的准确性、可靠性或完整性提供任何明示或暗示的保证。请读者仅作参考，并请自行承担全部责任。

description.hltext_display: Knife found on Paris Hilton plane
description.content:
Socialite and businesswoman Paris Hilton was escorted off her plane today when a fellow traveller discovered a four-inch serrated knife hidden in a pocket on the plane.
The socialite was heading to Maui for a sunshine break when the plane was evacuated by security at Los Angeles Airport, according to reports. "We were about to take off then security made everyone deplane because they found a big knife on board the plane.Scary that it got on plane," Hilton posted to her Twitter page.
Hilton was on the Delta Airlines Boeing 757 bound for Hawaii with with nighclub promoter boyfriend Cy Waits and 202 other people. A crew of eight were also onboard.
About an hour later, still apparently from the airport, she added: "They just finished the security sweep of the plane.About to board again "So strange a knife got on board. Can't wait to get to Maui." Delta spokeswoman Susan Elliott told AP it was a catering knife accidentally left behind by the cabin crew and the search was a precaution.
After the delay the plane took off as planned, Hilton tweeted.

event_or_fact.property: They just finished the security sweep of the plane.
it was a catering knife accidentally left behind by the cabin crew and the search was a precaution

description.content: เลลัง โล๊ะ สต็อก ต้อนรับ ทุกเทศกาลที่จะมาถึง ครับ80 บาท เท่านั้นครับ สำหรับกันรอย แบบ กระจก สำหรับ I phone 4 สินค้างานดี มีคุณภาพ หรูหรา สง่างาม เหมาะกับ I Phone 4 ของท่าน พร้อมส่ง ถึง บ้านท่านแน่นอน เลลัง โล๊ะ สต็อก ต้อนรับ ทุกเทศกาลที่จะมาถึง ครับ80 บาท เท่านั้นครับ เช็ค username ได้เลยครับ run 081 994 2552 วิธีการติด screen protector iphone1.ให้ลอกแถบกาว ที่ตัวหนังสือสีแดงออกก่อน ซึ่งจะเขียนเป็นภาษาอังกฤษ แปลได้ว่า ให้ลอกหรือดึงแผ่นนี้ออกก่อนทำการติดให้ลอกออกมาทั้งแผ่นเลย เมื่อลอกแล้วอย่าให้ แผ่นที่จะติดไปโดนฝุ่นหรือเส้นผม เพราะเป็นด้านที่จะติดกับหน้าจอ2.เมื่อลอก ตามข้อ 1 ออกมาแล้ว ให้ค่อยๆติดลงบนหน้าจอ โดยให้แล็งตรงปุ่ม Home ให้ดีให้วงตรงกลาง อยู่พอดีกันแต่อย่าเพิ่งติด นะครับ การเริ่มติดให้ติดจากมุมซ้ายหรือขวาก่อนก็ได้ แล้วค่อยรีดเป็นแนวทะแยงมุมไปจนสุดที่ต้องรีดเป็นแนวทะแยงมุม เพราะโอกาสจะมีฟองอากาศน้อยสุด หรือถ้ามีสามารถยกถอยออกมา แล้วรีดไปใหม่ได้ ทำช้าๆ ไปจนสุดมุมอีกด้าน ถ้ามีฟองอากาศเล็กๆ ตามขอบหรือมุม สามารถรีดออกได้ โดยใช้ไม้บรรทัดหรือเครดิตการ์ดหุ้มผ้า แล้วรีดออกไปด้านที่ใกล้สุด ขั้นตอนนี้สามารถ รีดบนผิวหน้าได้ เพราะเรายังมีแผ่นพลาสติค ที่ยังไม่ได้ลอกออกอยู่ขั้นบนไงครับ3.เมื่อทำขั้นตอนที่สองเสร็จ ให้ตรวจดูให้เรียบร้อยตามขอบ ว่าเรียบดีทุกจุด จนมาถึงขั้นสุดท้ายก็ค่อยดึง แถบกาวที่มีตัวหนังสือสีเขียว เป็นภาษาอังกฤษ ซึ่งแปลประมาณว่าให้ดึงออก หลังจากติดตั้งทุกอย่างเสร็จ ที่อยู่ชั้นบนสุด ก็จะเห็นความสดใสของฟิล์มที่อยู่หน้าจอ iphone เป็นเงางาม แบบกระจกชั้นดี ทีเดียว

description.hltext_display: Times Microwave Systems Announces Price Changes For LMR Products
description.content:
Due to increases in material costs for metals and petrochemicals used in the manufacturing of Times LMR cables, connectors and accessories and higher related costs including freight, prices will increase effective December 1, 2010.
LMR cables are flexible, non-kinking low loss RF transmission line cables that utilize easy-to-install connectors and are suitable for use as antenna feeders, system jumpers and interconnects. Times Microwave Systems is the industry leader in the design and manufacture of high performance coaxial cables and RF transmission line components.
About Times Microwave Systems
Times Microwave Systems has more than 60 years experience in designing innovative, high-reliability, coaxial cables and assemblies for demanding interconnection problems. Times specializes in the design and manufacture of high performance flexible and semi-rigid coaxial cable, connectors, and cable assemblies for RF transmission from HF through microwave frequencies as well as lightning and surge protection products.
SOURCE: Times Microwave Systems

description.hltext_display: Indonesia manufacturing to grow 5.2-6.1 pct in 2011 - minister
description.content: JAKARTA, Dec 22 (Reuters) - Indonesia's manufacturing sector is expected to grow by 5.2-6.1 percent next year and export non-oil/gas products worth $92.26 billion, industry minister M.S. Hidayat said on Wednesday. But the country's manufacturing industry -- including textiles and footwear -- needs investment of around 124.6 trillion rupiah ($13.78 billion) next year to reach the target, the minister said, in order to provide a total of 14.9 million jobs. In the first nine months this year Indonesian manufacturing grew by 4 percent from a year earlier, and Hidayat said growth was projected to surpass an initial full year target of 4.65 percent. "This will be a significant increase from the 2009 industrial growth of 1.54 percent," he said. The Southeast Asia's largest economy is poised to expand 6 percent this year and 6.4 percent in 2011, the finance ministry has said. ($1 = 9,042 rupiah) (Reporting by Yayat Supriatna; Writing by Aditya Suharmoko; Editing by David Fox) Keywords: INDONESIA ECONOMY/INDUSTRY (aditya.suharmoko@thomsonreuters.com)(+62 21 384 6364 ext 911)(Reuters Messaging: aditya.suharmoko.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net) COPYRIGHT Copyright Thomson Reuters 2010. All rights reserved.

description.hltext_display: NRW Atheisten: Handreichung für konfessionsfreie Schüler
description.content:
(News4Press.com) (Lindlar) Um den Jahreswechsel wählen viele Eltern die Grundschule oder suchen nach einer passenden weiterführenden Schule für ihre Kinder. Neben Bildungsangebot, Lehrerqualifikation und Erreichbarkeit ist auch die weltanschaulich-religiöse Ausrichtung ein wichtiges Kriterium für die beständig anwachsende Zahl nichtreligiöser Eltern. Der Internationale Bund der Konfessionslosen und Atheisten (IBKA) NRW stellt in seinem Internet-Angebot einen Fragebogen für Eltern zur Verfügung, mit dem sie die Wahrung der Religionsfreiheit ihrer Kinder bei Schulleitungen erfragen können. "Die Teilnahme am konfessionellen Religionsunterricht und Schulgottesdiensten ist für Schülerinnen und Schüler freiwillig. Das regelt unser Grundgesetz. Viele Lehrerinnen, Lehrer und Schulleitungen verwenden bedeutenden Ehrgeiz darauf, die Freiwilligkeit der Teilnahme am Religionsunterricht zu behindern. Hier werden die Grundrechte der nichtreligiösen Schüler massiv verletzt!" sagt IBKA-NRW Sprecher Rainer Ponitka. "Manche Grundschulen lassen Unterrichtsfächer beim gleichen Lehrer ineinander übergehen. Der Religionsunterricht hat keine verbindlichen Zeiten im Stundenplan. Es wird Eltern massiv erschwert, ihre Kinder vor religiöser Indoktrination zu schützen." Dem Fragebogen liegt die aktuelle Gesetzes- und Erlasslage in Nordrhein-Westfalen zugrunde. Erfragt wird die Beaufsichtigung der konfessionsfreien Schüler zur Zeit des Religionsunterrichtes, die verbindlichen Zeiten des Religionsunterrichtes im Stundenplan, sowie die Häufigkeit von Gottesdiensten im Schulhalbjahr. Ponitka weiter: "Der Religionsunterricht hat die Aufgabe, die Glaubensinhalte der Religionsgemeinschaften als bestehende Wahrheiten zu vermitteln. Das hat das Bundesverfassungsgericht 1987 bestätigt. Somit kann man den Religionsunterricht als pure Mitgliederschulung der Religionsgemeinschaften bezeichnen. Nirgendwo sonst im schulischen Bereich wird so viel kriminelle Energie darauf verwendet, die bestehende Rechtslage zu umgehen und nichtreligiöse Menschen in der Ausübung ihrer Freiheitsrechte zu behindern." Hintergrund: Der IBKA in Nordrhein-Westfalen berät seit dem Schuljahr 2007 / 2008 nichtreligiöse Schüler, Eltern und Lehrer und unterstützt sie in der Wahrung ihrer Religionsfreiheit. Weiterführende Links: Fragebogen für Eltern - http://www.ibka.org/frageGS-NRW Schulrundschreiben 2009 / 10 - http://ibka.org/node/897 AG Schule des IBKA - http://ibka.org/ag-schule Über den IBKA: Im IBKA haben sich nichtreligiöse Menschen zusammengeschlossen, um die allgemeinen Menschenrechte - insbesondere die Weltanschauungsfreiheit - und die konsequente Trennung von Staat und Religion durchzusetzen. Wir treten ein für individuelle Selbstbestimmung, wollen vernunftgeleitetes Denken fördern und über die gesellschaftliche Rolle von Religion aufklären.
Rainer Ponitka IBKA e.V., Landessprecher NRW Steinbach 19 51789 Lindlar Tel.: +49-(0)2266-9015244 Mobil: +49-(0)170-8122250 E-Mail: presse-nrw@ibka.org www.ibka.org/nrw

description.hltext_display: Raises on hold for Eddy County employees
description.content:
CARLSBAD — To county employees, the tabling of proposed market salary increases by the Eddy County Commission may seem Scrooge-like at this time of year. But the majority of the commission believes it is the responsible thing to do, at least for now.
In a 3-2 vote, the commission tabled the request for market salary increases from the county's human resource director Kenney Rayroux, saying that the issue will be revisited in April after the mid-year budget review.
County Manager Allen Sartin said data for the review is currently in the process of being put together by the county's finance director.
Casting their vote to approve the salary increases - to start in February - were commissioners Roxanne Lara and Tony Hernandez.
The cost of the market salary increases is close to $600,000.
Rayroux said he conducted an annual salary survey of 10 governmental entities and data from the state's Department of Workforce Solutions to determine appropriate salary levels for Eddy County employees. He said many positions warrant salary increases because they are below market, while others are at market or the job pay rate is on par with similar positions in other local government entities in the region.
Rayroux said Eddy County has not given its employees a market salary increase in two years.
Sartin told the commission that oil and gas revenues in the first five months of the 2010-2011 fiscal year that started in July came in at $1 million
over the projected amount. He said the surplus could be used for the salary increases.
Hernandez, in voting for the salary increases, said he is concerned that Eddy County is already two years behind in market salary increases. The same concern was voiced by Lara.
Commissioner Guy Lutman said approving salary increases for county employees at a time when private industry is cutting back due to the economic climate is a concern for him.
"What message are we sending to the taxpayers?" Lutman said. "It's the citizens who are paying the salaries for county employees. My other concern is that the state has a budget deficit and the Legislature will be looking at ways to make budget cuts. We have been blessed to get through this year in good financial shape. But when they see that we can afford to give pay increases they could make cuts to our project monies."
Rayroux said competing with the oil and gas industry, which pays higher wages, is difficult. He said recently a county employee left to take a job in the industry at double his county salary.
"That's the way cookie crumbles," Lutman replied. "Some people like the security of having a county job and the benefits that come with it, while others may leave for higher paying jobs with less benefits and job security."
Commissioner Lewis Derrick said the county is unable to pay employees double the rate to keep them from leaving. He said the key is to make sure they have "good" tools they need to do their job.
"I have nothing against salary increases and taking care of county employees - not one bit. I apologize to our employees that we are tabling this at this time. But I have to also look out for the taxpayers," he said. "The state and federal government is deeply in debt. We have to see what is going to happen when the state Legislature meets in January. I think we need to wait until we do our mid-year budget review before we make any decision."
Commission Chairman Jack Volpato agreed, adding that he would feel much more comfortable postponing the decision until April.
The commission also tabled a request from Sartin to increase staffing in the county's human resource department. The commission said it would take the proposal under consideration and render a decision in April.
Sartin explained a comparison of existing staffing to industry standards showed that the human resource department is significantly understaffed for a county the size of Eddy County. He said a county government the size and complexity of Eddy County would typically have one full-time personnel analyst for every 100 employees. He said Eddy County has about 300 full-time employees and should have three personnel analysts.
Sartin said the county human resource department is responsible for wage and benefit administration, recruitment, training and staff development, positions classification and job descriptions, administration of personnel policy and procedures and employee discipline.
"Currently, there is one personnel analyst with the part-time support of the human resource director to perform all of these functions," Sartin explained. "During my first year as county manager, it became very clear that a great many functions were not being accomplished by the human resource department."
Providing an example, Sartin said that many job descriptions were badly in need of updating, adding that some had not been updated in 17 years.
"The performance appraisal form was inadequate per current industry standards, recruiting takes too long from (job) advertising close to interviews. There is little focus on long-term staffing shortages and there is little statistical data available on staffing patterns and issues to name a few of the significant shortcomings," Sartin said, adding that being shorthanded, the department continue to primarily focus on meeting minimum legal requirements.

description.hltext_display: Wenn nichts mehr geht, helfen die Devils
description.content:
Kurz vor dem Duell mit dem großen Rivalen Pittsburgh Penguins spielen sich die Washington Capitals in Form - obwohl die Stars weiter schwächeln. Die Hauptstädter deklassieren die unterirdischen New Jersey Devils. Komplett unter die Räder kommt die zuletzt so heiße Colorado Avalanche beim Heimspiel gegen die L.A. Kings.
Washington Capitals (20-12-4, 44 Pts) - New Jersey Devils (9-22-2, 20 Pts) 5:1
Am Donnerstag trifft Washington auf Pittsburgh. Das wird die Generalprobe zum Winter Classic am 1. Januar, wenn die Caps und Pens erneut die Klingen kreuzen. Doch zuvor galt es, sich der Pflichtaufgabe New Jersey zu entledigen. Nichts leichter als das.
Anzeige
Die Capitals spielen dieser Tage keinesfalls überzeugend, und auch gegen die Devils waren insbesondere die Stars phasenweise erschreckend schlecht. Aber erstens hat Washington Tiefe, sodass auch die dritte und vierte Reihe mal einen Sieg sicher stellen können. Zweitens kann man gegen New Jersey im Prinzip machen, was man will.
Die Gäste gestatteten unter anderem Andrew Gordon das erste NHL-Tor seiner junge Karriere, wonach der Youngster völlig ausflippte. Vor lauter Glück drückte er seinem Kollegen Marcus Johansson einen satten Schmatzer auf die Wange. Wenig später legte er mit einem Assist auch noch einen Treffer von Jason Chimera auf.
Zudem trafen Jay Beagle, John Carlson und Mike Knuble. Für die Devils traf Patrik Elias zum zwischenzeitlichen Ausgleich: "Siege sind natürlich gut für die Stimmung", freute sich Coach Bruce Boudreau. "In der Kabine waren die Jungs natürlich viel gelöster als während unserer Niederlagenserie." Pittsburgh kann kommen.
Colorado Avalanche (19-11-4, 42 Pts) - L.A. Kings (19-12-1, 39 Pts) 0:5
In einem Wort: eindrucksvoll. Denn genau das war die Leistung der Kings gegen Colorado. Sechs Spiele hatten die Avalanche nicht mehr verloren - bis die Kings kamen. Die Kings - und genauer gesagt Dustin Brown und Jonathan Quick. Brown war mit zwei Toren und zwei Assists bester Mann auf dem Eis und Quick hielt zum dritten Mal in dieser Saison seinen Kasten sauber.

description.hltext_display: Once In A Lifetime: Lunar Eclipse, Winter Solstice
description.author: Staff Reports
description.content: These images of Tuesday's lunar eclipse, fashioned into a composite, were taken in Sand Springs at 12:51 a.m., 1:08 a.m., 1:39 a.m., 1:54 a.m. and 2:26 a.m. A lunar eclipse occurs when the Earth is positioned between the sun and the moon. Although the moon passes through the Earth's shadow, the lunar disk remains partially illuminated by sunlight that is refracted and scattered by the Earth's atmosphere, according to NASA. The eclipse coincided with the winter solstice for the first time in more than three centuries - the last time being Dec. 21, 1638. The phenomenon will take place again on Dec. 21, 2094, according to U.S. Naval Observatory spokesman Geoff Chester. JOEY JOHNSON/for the Tulsa World

description.hltext_display: 09:30 PSG Clash entre Sessegnon et Kombouar?
description.content: Stéphane Sessègnon et Antoine Kombouaré auraient discuté de manière plus que virulente, mardi. L'entraîneur est même allé jusqu'à insulter l'ancien joueur du Mans. C'est la raison pour laquelle le Béninois ne sera finalement pas dans le groupe qui se déplacera à Nancy mercredi soir pour le compte de la 19e journée de Ligue 1. Le Paris Saint-Germain a essayé de dédramatiser la situation: "L'entraîneur et Stéphane Sessegnon ont eu une discussion aujourd'hui. À la suite de cet échange, Antoine Kombouaré a préféré laisser le joueur souffler pour lui permettre de couper en espérant qu'il revienne régénéré de ses vacances."

description.hltext_display: Il prefetto di Roma «Vogliono alzare la tensione»
Alamogordo, Tularosa groups will provide Christmas Day meals again for the community
description.content:
Alamogordo Daily News
Posted: 12/22/2010 12:00:00 AM MST
Click photo to enlarge
Warren Robinson, right, helps serve Christmas Dinner at the Prince Lodge in 2009 during the annual Lonnie Troy Christmas Dinner.
Two longstanding providers of Christmas dinners to the community are once again working the kitchens of Alamogordo and Tularosa. The Lonnie Troy Annual Christmas Dinner and the Tularosa Christmas Day Meal are scheduled for eat-in and delivery options.
In Tularosa, the Christmas Day Meal has outgrown its former location and found a new home at the Tularosa Community Center.
The annual event will offer food and live music, as well as deliveries to homebound people. Deliveries begin at 9:30 a.m., while the doors open for served meals at 11 a.m. and close at 2 p.m.
"This project is only possible by donations of cooked foods such as turkeys, hams, other meats, vegetables and desserts," said organizer Astrid Curry. "Please help if you are able."
Curry also would like to encourage people who know of homebound neighbors to help arrange a delivery.
"Many people are lonely and need companionship on this wonderful day and can find it here in our community," she said. "If you know of any people who are homebound and need a delivery, contact us."
Curry can be reached at 585-2513 or 430-0681.
Prince Hall Lodge No. 11 will again serve and deliver the Lonnie Troy Annual Christmas Dinner to Alamogordo homebound citizens. Those who are not homebound can head to the lodge at 310 Delaware Ave. for dinner.
The Prince Lodge is a Masonic organization with about 35 members in the area. The group conducts the dinner and performs other beneficial charity work in the community,
such as passing out Thanksgiving and Christmas baskets.
Lodge member Charles Norman said though community support for the dinner is strong, help is always needed so if anyone is able to help out, that help will be greatly appreciated.
Dinner will be served from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Christmas Day at the Prince Hall. Deliveries are available to the elderly, disabled and people without transportation. Delivery reservations are accepted until Dec. 24.
People who would like a delivery or who wish to volunteer or contribute can call Norman at 437-1592 or Clarence Wallace at 434-2724.
Contact Elva K. Osterreich at eosterreich@alamogordonews.com.

description.hltext_display: Govt to apologise for Haneef wrongful detention
description.content: Former Gold Coast doctor Mohamed Haneef will receive a public apology from the Federal Government over his wrongful detention. The Indian-born doctor was held for 25 days on suspicion of helping a terrorist organisation. He's been awarded compensation but the amount won't be revealed.

description.hltext_display: Не подмигивайте маскам
description.content:
Надо признать: у нас сработала старая-престарая схема: Геббельс советовал отслеживать все несчастные случаи в британской печати, — утонул ли кто-то, под машину попал или убит в бытовой драке… Выискивать и объявлять, что это евреи совершают свои ритуальные убийства. В каждом конкретном регионе выискивались именно местные случаи. Уже два года, как у нас специальные бригады манипуляторов с нацистких сайтов перешли на городские, профессиональные и другие сайты разных сообществ. Они именно так и поступали – выискивали местные случаи смертей и массированно обсуждали, заменив слово «евреи» - мигрантами, кавказцами и т.д.: «…Нас окружили мигранты! Нас убивают! Они нас специально истребляют…». В каких-то городах им удавалось раскачать ситуацию до того, что нервничать и всерьез верить в то, что «идет война народная» начинали ничего не подозревающие «жители» этих сайтов… Но по–настоящему «сыграть» удалось, как мы видим, именно в болельщиков «Спартака», а позже и в подтянувшихся школьников, часть из которых, вовсе не имеет никакого отношения к футболу…
Время теперь разделилось на то, что было до и то, что происходит после «манежки». Это теперь устойчивое выражение речи и не менее устойчивое выражение бытовой мимики людей – тревога, страх, ненависть и, подчас – недоумение. Что происходит - самый популярный вопрос «постманежной» истории страны.
— Что в самом деле происходит? – спрашиваю и я у известного психолога, директора Федерального института развития образования, заведующего кафедрой психологии личности МГУ, профессора Александра Асмолова.
— Нет простого ответа на сложную, полимотивированную ситуацию. Есть факты: Россия все более становится страной развитой ксенофобии. И резкие установки связаны с тем, что даже на политическом уровне мы делим людей на наших и не наших, местных и не таковых. В сложных, неопределенных условиях подобная поляризация подогревает агрессию, и она выливается в потоки, именно, - в потоки ненависти. Общая ксенофобская ситуация – это благоприятная среда для экстремизма. Я полагаю, что наивны те, кто пытается все свести к футбольным фанатам, которые присутствовали на Манежной площади и, подогреваемые жаждой справедливости в связи с неадекватными действиями правоохранительных органов, устроили такие чудовищные эксцессы. Или к криминальной среде, которая закравшись среди фанатов, побуждала их действовать все более экстремистки… Или к теме неустойчивости психики подростков и молодежи. Хотя, конечно же, все названное имеет место. Но надо обратить внимание на четкие, давно отработанные технологии, которые явно были применены в толпе на Манежной - много гипнабельных воздействий, на которые именно многотысячная толпа и реагирует, а потому и риск зараженности экстремизмом всегда высок. Слаженные действия и выкрики - перед нами, я бы сказал, профессиональная работа.
— Чья она по вашему?
— Ясно, что определенных политических, а не криминальных, и уж, тем более, не фанатских групп. Я не могу их назвать, но если мы вглядимся в клипы, которые вбрасываются в интернет, мы увидим что сегодня вытаскиваются давно позабытые термины. Святая Русь призывается к Крестовому походу против «жидов и сарацинов». В том, что всегда во всем жиды виноваты – это формула отличается уникальной новизной…. Но термин времен средневековья – сарацины! Под ним подразумевались те, кто был врагом гроба Господня и не важно: были ли это арабы или другие инаковерующие.
На первый план выходил не этнический признак – а признак любого, кто «против нас». Формула «против кого дружите» была знаменем крестовых походов против сарацинов.
— Сарацины – это все не согласные?
— Эти термины вытащены сегодня - это означает, что определенные политические группы взяли не только риторику, но и идеологию крестового похода за святую Русь.
И к этому средству прибегают политические группы всех времен и народов, когда цель – достижение дестабилизации общества, попытка изменения политического режима… С моей точки зрения, если мы не увидим этих вещей, а будем только искать виновных, которые на поверхности – ничего не изменится. Потому, что происшедшее на Манежной, а позже на Киевской, и у Останкино, не может быть объяснимым, если за этим не стоит серьезная политическая программа серьезного политического ресурса.
— Вы имеете ввиду националистические движения?
— Сейчас широко используются эти названия, но я бы избегал их. За этим стоит другая матрица сознания. Мы сталкиваемся с тем, что называется проявлением фундаментализма во всем мире. Частными проекциями его идеологии были и итальянский фашизм, и немецкий национал–социализм, и другие проявления тоталитарных культур, которые приводят к обезличиванию человека.
Сезон фанатиков наступил в 2010 году, в этих всплесках, которые мы видели на Манежке и в еще большей степени в следующих эпизодах. Первый – это разговор руководителя московской милиции с анонимным лидером – он в маске.
— Он не снял ее даже после того, как ему это было предложено сделать…
— Не снял. Переговорщик был в маске, обезличенность – это рисунок определенных политических групп. Он выдвигал требования с определенной риторикой, там можно проследить присущую фундаменталистам мистическую, культовую окраску. Мы имеем дело с очень серьезным явлением. И все–таки, Манежная площадь – открытое пространство. Наверное, многие видели ролик из метро, когда часть оказалась в закрытом пространстве – страх и фанатизм там достигли апогея. Клаустрофобия помогает достичь предела. И мы имели толпу как единое целое, управляемое мощными организаторами, одаренными в области манипулятивных воздействий.
— Ситуация на Киевской, у торгового центра «Европейский» тоже явно была срежиссирована?
— Конечно, был использован Интернет как великий анонимный мобилизатор сознания. Мы имеем дело с талантливыми блогерами, которые обслуживают это действие и опять же с четкой политической и продуманной программой. Одна и та же стилистика одним почерком говорит «бей иноверцев» или «защищай иноверцев от русских». В зависимости от того, к каким этническим группам молодежи и подростков направлено обращение…
— Давно известно, что когда указывается враг, - включаются инстинкты у людей, скажем так мягко, нереализованных. И может быть, тому, кто на этом играет, не столько даже важен факт, что он приобретает контроль. Важнее то, что все вокруг - нормальные люди, - теряют контроль. И вот эта растерянность у многих, панические настроения, ужас и страх, как после терактов, - что законопослушным людям с этим делать? Что вы, как психолог посоветуете?
— Бессмысленно давать советы в этой ситуации. Их нужно давать не законопослушным людям, а тем, кто в буквальном смысле заигрывает с экстремистами…
Есть полное заигрывание. Когда в телепрограммах говорят, что надо узаконить лидеров нацистских движений и тогда все успокоится… Пусть они выступят, давайте их послушаем, давайте им покланяемся…
— Да, какие–то из этих лидеров превратились в последние дни просто в телезвезд…
— Так же, как для террориста интервью — это подтверждение его значимости, так же и здесь, - с ними нельзя заигрывать, это уже довело нас до Манежной…
— Есть еще один момент, которого я лично не могу понять… Происходит какое-то удивительное смешение – ты читаешь, к примеру абсолютно фашистский, по содержанию текст, но видишь, что это – вовсе не нацистское издание… Даже на нацистских сайтах сегодня более взвешенные статьи. Что движет «перьями» моих коллег, - страх, конъюнктура, тупость? К примеру, статья, не буду называть издание и автора, чтобы не увеличивать пространства зла, призывает к нулевой толерантности к выходцам с Кавказа. К юридическому террору, чтобы, как там говорится, если «один Аслан» задержан, то другие бежали бы от этого места со всех ног, так как они будут признаны не свидетелями, а соучастниками…
— Это - абсолютно гитлеровские лозунги, переход от личности к толпе. Ты виноват, потому что принадлежишь к этой культуре. Цыган уничтожать за то, что они цыгане. Евреев за то, что евреи…Выходцев с Кавказа…
Это - легализация безличностных отношений между людьми, превращение России в страну этнических войн
— Причем, ладно бы, сам автор додумался до таких терминов, так нет, он берет за основу пример США, когда вот так полиция относилась к байкерам, которые запугивали мирное население. Ложь, в том, что юридический террор по отношению к преступникам он сравнивает с возможностью такого же метода по отношению к людям разных народов…
— Ложь всегда приходит в красивых обертках. Когда журналисты или лидеры партий что-то говорят, я, считая их неглупыми людьми, всегда задаю один вопрос — кому это выгодно? Вот появляются статьи с такой славянской символикой, с фамилиями - Пересветов, к примеру. Статья: «я толерантен», где рассказывается, какой вред наносит толерантность России. Толерантность, по-прежнему, понимается, как терпимость, но это - право иного быть иным, поддержка культурного и исторического разнообразия страны. Что такое патриотизм без толерантности к иным народам? Это даже не этнофобия, а человекофобия, желание уничтожить человека только за то, что он не такой как ты, он – иной.
— Есть еще такой конек у якобы здраво рассуждающих, не фашиствующих: лозунг «Россия для русских» поддерживает большая часть населения, а значит их должны услышать власти. Но вот если, к примеру, эпидемия холеры, - это же не значит, что отныне только имеющие это заболевание диктуют условия жизни всем остальным? Законы должны удерживать болезненные общественные настроения.
— Кстати, законы именно в эти дни работают, и надо отдать должное милиции – они ведут себя правильно… Это очень важно отметить! Что же касается всего остального, - приведу пример Мюнхена, города, где был в свое время один из очагов проявления национал социализма. Там введен во всех школах обязательный курс – « анализ тоталитарных систем и их последствий. Не уроки патриотизма … а анализ… «Нам трудно, - говорят мои немецкие коллеги из министерства образования Боварии, - родители, которые родились уже после фашизма не понимают, почему их дети должны отвечать за то, что было?». Но есть ответ: «чтобы это не повторилось и чтобы и вы, и ваши дети знали последствия фашизма для мира » У нас же стыдливо умалчивается о Холокосте. И идет заигрывание взрослых с темой «засилья инородцев»… С масками… Мы с вами уже как то говорили о том, что слышится много мотивировок, - они и сегодня на поверхности… А вот истинная мотивация происходящего – закрыта…
Начнутся новые холокосты, если не прекратить заигрывания…

description.hltext_display: Počas sviatkov dávajte pozor na žlčník! Neprejedajte sa
description.content:
Žlčnikári by mali zabudnúť na opekané zemiaky alebo hranolčeky.
Autor: archív
Rozumná dávka striedmosti je namieste u každého. To však neznamená askézu a odriekanie. Len sa vyhýbať častému prejedaniu. Tráviace problémy pri žlčových kameňoch sú síce nepríjemné, ale ak nemáte bolesti a nehrozí zápal, pomôžete si aj doma. A to krátkodobou hladovkou s vylúčením tuku.
Zaberajú aj viaceré lieky na báze spazmolytík alebo pankreatických enzýmov. Ťažkosti by mali po čase ustúpiť a žlčník sa upokojí. Keď vás začne bolieť pod pravým rebrom a strieľa to až pod pravú lopatku, máte horúčku, triašku a je vám na vracanie, ide o príznaky žlčníkového záchvatu. Tu už treba čo najrýchlejšie ísť k lekárovi. Žlčový kameň upchal vývod, dostali ste koliku a tú len tak nevyležíte. Ak sa ku kolike pridruží zápal steny žlčníka a hrozí jej prederavenie, ide o život ohrozujúci stav a chirurgický zákrok je nevyhnutný.
Extra tip: Žlčnikári by mali zabudnúť na opekané zemiaky alebo hranolčeky. Používajte iba rastlinné oleje a tuky. Žlčník dráždi aj čerstvá paprika, cesnak, korenie karí. Z jedálneho lístka by mali vypadnúť aj majonézy a lístkové cesto. Okrem stravy môže žlčník podráždiť takisto stres, fajčenie a alkohol.

description.hltext_display: Girls basketball: Duda's late jumper fuels Framingham
description.author: Staff reports
description.content:
Senior forward Rachael Duda hit a game-winning 15-footer with 10 seconds left in overtime to lift Framingham over Weymouth 53-51 in a thrilling Bay State Conference girls basketball matchup last night.
Duda finished the game with four points and seven rebounds and junior forward Claryssa Cunniff (8 points, 12 rebounds, 5 steals, 3 blocks) had a terrific all-around game for the Flyers (1-1, 1-1 BSC).
Guards Leah Douty and Melissa Reynaud scored 14 points each for Framingham.
WELLESLEY 61, DEDHAM 29: Senior captain Blake Dietrick was dominant, scoring 21 points to go along with 15 rebounds and three steals as Wellesley cruised to a Bay State Herget victory over Dedham.
Junior guard Caroline Harrington chipped in with 11 points and two steals and freshman guard Sophia Mavrommatis had nine points and three steals for Wellesley (3-0, 2-0 BSC), which jumped in front early and held comfortable leads for most of the game. The Raiders led 35-12 at the half.
HOPKINTON 61, HOLLISTON 45: Sophomore point guard Tess Chandler had 15 points to lift visiting Hopkinton over Tri-Valley rival Holliston.
Junior forward Lindsey Doucette added 13 points for the Hillers (2-1) while junior guard Victoria Munger chipped in with nine points.
Ashley Higgins scored 13 points and Vicky Sostilio netted 11 points for Holliston (2-1).
ASHLAND 55, NORTON 37: Kristen Kenney had a double-double with 18 points and 16 rebounds as visiting Ashland rolled past Norton in a Tri-Valley League tilt.
Natalie Leone (13 points, 8 steals, 6 rebounds) and Blake Underhill (15 points, 4 steals) also had strong efforts for the Clockers (2-1 TVL).
WESTWOOD 48, MILLIS 16: Junior guard Keriann Brady played well defensively as Millis dropped a Tri-Valley League tilt to visiting Westwood.
Trailing 25-5 at the half, the Mohawks (1-3, 0-3 TVL) struggled to get going offensively. Sophomore guard Uche Osuagwu also played well defensively for the Mohawks.
MEDFIELD 65, MEDWAY 50: Senior Sarah Coakley and sophomore Sarah Hope had 15 points each for Medway in a Tri-Valley League loss at Medfield.
Medway (2-1, 2-1 TVL) stayed close in the first half as Medfield held a 35-31 lead at the break. Sophomore Jen Narlee and senior Kate Wasley helped Medfield (4-0, 3-0 TVL) pull away in the second half, each scoring 16 points.
DOVER-SHERBORN 52, BELLINGHAM 41: Senior captain Catherine Ogilvee pulled down 14 rebounds and netted seven points in leading Dover-Sherborn to a win over Tri-Valley rival Bellingham.
Junior A.J. Dessert recorded a double-double with 12 points and 11 rebounds, sophomore Norah Klemmer scored 12 points and sophomore Abby Greene added 10 points for D-S (1-2, 1-2 TVL).
WAYLAND 35, BEDFORD 23: Sophomore center Jen Berkowitz had 18 points and 18 rebounds as Wayland downed visiting Bedford in Dual County League action. Emily Ivker added nine points and eight steals for the Warriors (3-1, 2-1 DCL).
WESTFORD 46, LINCOLN-SUDBURY 44: Senior forward Ali Murray had 13 points, six rebounds, four steals and three blocks, but Lincoln-Sudbury fell to visiting Westford in Dual County League Large action.
Sophomore forward Many Sifferlen (6 points, 9 rebounds, 3 blocks) and Lindsey Jones (4 points, 8 steals, 3 assists, 2 rebounds) also played well for the Warriors (2-1, 0-1DCL Large), who trailed 20-18 at the half.
CONCORD-CARLISLE 51, ARLINGTON 38: Jesse Castelline had 15 points as Concord-Carlisle defeated Arlington in Dual County League Small play. Halle Burns added 12 points for the Patriots (1-2, 1-0 DCL Small).
FRANKLIN 69, STOUGHTON 30: Senior forward Meg Shaw had 19 points, including five 3-pointers, as Franklin cruised to a Hockomock League win over visiting Stoughton.
Senior forward Sam Irvine added 12 points while Sarah Doherty had eight points and eight assists for the Panthers (3-0, 2-0 HL).
LOWELL CATHOLIC 37, MARIAN 36: Junior Monica Hanley scored 12 points and hauled in eight rebounds for Marian, but the Mustangs were edged by Lowell Catholic in a Catholic Central tilt.
The Mustangs (2-1) also received solid efforts from Kat Finnegan (8 points), Alexandra Erath (7 points, 5 steals), Courtney James (11 rebounds), and Devan Rabidou (5 points, 3 assists, 2 steals).
VALLEY TECH 51, ST. MARY'S 37: Kaitlin Hannon had 24 points, six steals and four rebounds as Valley Tech defeated St. Mary's of Worcester in the opening round of the Valley Tech Holiday Tournament.
Valley Tech (1-0) faces Pathfinder, which beat Bethany Christian Academy in the other opening round game, tonight in the final at 5 p.m.
Sarah Collins added 15 points while Kelly Ney had six rebounds and three steals for the Beavers.
ASSABET 58, CLINTON 45: Senior guard Ashley Salem had 15 points, including four 3-pointers, to lead Assabet to a non-league win over visiting Clinton. Senior forward Vanessa Joubert added 13 points and eight rebounds while freshman point guard Tia Joubert chipped in with 11 points, six steals, and four assists for the Aztecs (2-1).
NIPMUC 48, WORCESTER SOUTH 24: Junior guard Elana Fazio collected 10 points, five assists and four steals to leading Nipmuc to a non-league win over Worcester South.
Junior center Ashley Farineau added 10 points and junior guard Amanda Rayos had nine points and four steals for Nipmuc (1-2, 0-1 DVL).
AUBURN 45, HUDSON 32: Junior Marie Hydro scored nine points for Hudson in a non-league loss to visiting Auburn.
Sophomore Kara Knights had eight points for the Hawks (1-2), who took an 18-15 lead into halftime before Auburn pulled away over the last 16 minutes.

description.hltext_display: Vendido en Íscar (Valladolid) el 75.869, el primero de los quintos premios dotado con 50.000 euros
description.content: VALLADOLID, 22 (EUROPA PRESS) El número 75.869, que ha resultado agraciado con uno de los quintos premios del Sorteo Extraordinario de Lotería de Navidad y dotado con 50.000 euros a la serie, ha sido vendido en la administración de Lotería de Íscar (Valladolid) de la calle Mayor. El número fue cantado a las 9,33 horas en el séptimo alambre de la primera tabla.

description.hltext_display: Woman sentenced in witness tampering
description.author: BILL BRAUN
description.content: A woman is serving a 60-day stint in the Tulsa Jail for interfering with witnesses in case against her husband, a doctor who was eventually acquitted of the sexual abuse of a child. Carrie Ann Schlesner, also known as Carrie Smith, pleaded guilty in June to two felony counts linked to allegations that in 2008 she tried to alter or prevent testimony from two children in the case against Kirk Michael Smith. Tulsa County jurors in June found Kirk Smith not guilty of a charge of sexually abusing one of those witnesses - a girl who was 6 when the abuse charge was filed in 2008. Kirk Smith, 37, repeatedly testified that he never molested that girl - a family member who testified at the trial. The offense was alleged to have occurred at a Bixby residence. Schlesner ended her participation as a defendant in that trial by pleading guilty to the witness counts before the case was submitted to the jury. According to a court document, Schlesner indicated that in July 2008 she yelled at the girl and a boy who was then 10, called them liars and persuaded them to give statements that were inconsistent with events. District Judge Kurt Glassco imposed a two-year deferred sentence. Schlesner, 38, can have her case dismissed without a conviction if she completes a probation that is set to expire in October 2012. Glassco also ordered her to serve a 60-day jail term that started Sunday, records show. Before his 2008 arrest, Kirk Smith had practiced family medicine. He has a license to practice medicine in Oklahoma that expires May 1, records show. Schlesner and Smith are involved in a divorce action in Tulsa County District Court, records show. Original Print Headline: Woman in jail for witness crimes Bill Braun 581-8455 bill.braun@tulsaworld.com

event_or_fact.property: in July 2008 she yelled at the girl and a boy who was then 10, called them liars and persuaded them to give statements that were inconsistent with events.

description.hltext_display: St. Magnus bleibt punktlos
description.content: Bremen-Nord. In der Volleyball-Landesliga 4 der Frauen ist der TSV St. Magnus auch am letzten Spieltag des Jahres ohne Erfolg geblieben. Mit zwei Siegen verabschiedete sich hingegen der Vegesacker TV II in die Weihnachtspause.

description.hltext_display: Vychutnajte si Vianoce bez priberania
description.content:
Blížia sa sviatky, ktoré v preklade často znamenajú aj „prejedacie“ obdobie. My však vieme, ako ich môžete prežiť bez zbytočných kíl navyše.
Vychutnajte si jedlo a maškrťte.
Autor: archív
Ľahké sviatočné menu
Ak sa chcete nielen dobre cítiť, ale aj výborne vyzerať, stavte na zdravšiu a energeticky menej výdatnú stravu. Ako na to?
Raňajky
Na stôl pripravte nakrájané jabĺčka a banány, na mesiačiky rozdelené pomaranče, grepy a mandarínky. Keď ich budete mať celý deň na očiach, skôr si z nich dzobnete ako z koláčikov. Na raňajky jedzte veľa bielkovín a vlákniny, aby ste tak skoro nevyhladli a nepodľahli vianočným lákadlám.
Obed
Uprostred dňa si tiež vyberajte jedlá s vyšším obsahom bielkovín. Najlepšou prílohou je zelenina, ktorú si môžete upraviť tak, ako vám najviac chutí. Nikdy si k stolu nesadajte celkom hladná, lebo budete mať chuť na všetko, čo uvidíte.
Slávnostná večera
Vo väčšine slovenských rodín je hlavným chodom kapustnica a vyprážaná ryba s majonézovým šalátom. Tento rok však u vás doma môžete urobiť menšie zmeny a pritom neporušiť tradície.
Naše tipy: Kapustnica bez tuku Kapusta sama osebe patrí medzi zdravé potraviny, obsahuje veľa vitamínu C a vlákninu, priaznivo vplýva na črevnú mikroflóru a podporuje trávenie. Kapustnica však už až taká zdravá nie je. Hlavne vtedy, keď do nej pridáte množstvo klobásy a mastného údeného mäsa. Skúste tieto prísady nahradiť sójovým mäsom a poriadnou dávkou sušených húb. Na zahustenie namiesto smotany a zápražky použite zemiaky.
Rybu nevyprážajte
Aj ryba je v skutočnosti veľmi dôležitá pre náš organizmus, nie však obalená v strúhanke a napitá olejom. Vychutnajte si ju ugrilovanú, upečenú, poduste alebo povarte váš obľúbený druh a dochuťte ho čerstvými bylinkami. Jogurt namiesto majonézy Do tradičného zemiakového šalátu pridajte namiesto ťažkej majonézy lahodný jogurtový dresing. Rozdiel v chuti bude minimálny, možno vám zachutí ešte viac. Ak nemáte vlastný recept na zdravý zemiakový šalát, prikladáme ten náš.
Zemiakový šalát s jogurtom
Pre 4 osoby: 600 g zemiakov uvarených v šupke olúpeme a nakrájame na kocky. Pridáme 80 g nadrobno pokrájanej cibule, 80 g najemno nastrúhanej mrkvy, 200 g uvarených strukovín, 100 g kapusty nakrájanej na rezančeky a 100 g nasekaných zaváraných uhoriek. Primiešame 1 téglik jogurtu s trochou sójovej omáčky a dáme do chladničky. Nezabudnite ani na pravidelný pitný režim vo forme pramenitej či minerálnej vody a čaju.
Hurá na sladké!
Ak si hovoríte, že k Vianociam sladkosti jednoducho patria, máte pravdu. Nemusíte však zjesť všetky koláče, ktoré vám prídu pod ruku. Znamenajú pre vás nadmerný prísun kalórií, tukov a cukrov. Urobíte preto lepšie, keď si v byte na viaceré miesta rozložíte čerstvé alebo sušené ovocie, orechy a rozličné semienka. Veľmi chutné a osviežujúce sú tiež ovocné poháre zaliate želatínou. Alebo siahnite po recepte našich starých materí – pečené jabĺčka sú mimoriadne chutné a zdravé. Ak sa napriek všetkému rozhodnete napiecť, používajte radšej celozrnnú, ražnú alebo pohánkovú múku. Biely cukor nahraďte medom alebo trstinovým cukrom. Na zlepovanie koláčikov voľte namiesto maslových krémov ich ľahšie jogurtové alebo tvarohové varianty. Ak plech nevymastíte a nevysypete múkou, ale použijete papier na pečenie, takisto ušetríte zopár kalórií.
Chutné a štíhle kokteily
Sú rýchlo hotové a obsahujú málo kalórií. Tak ochutnajte!
Jablkovo-ríbezľový
Na 1 pohár zmiešame 125 ml jablkovej šťavy, 150 ml ríbezľovej šťavy, trocha mletej škorice a 100 ml sladkej srvátky. Energetická hodnota 1 pohára: 481 kJ
Uhorkovo-mrkvový
Na 1 nápoj zmiešame šťavu z 300 g uhorky a 200 g mrkvy, pridáme 20 ml žihľavového čaju a 2 kvapky olivového oleja. Energetická hodnota 1 pohára: 527 kJ
Ako odolať pokušeniu
Vezmite si na pomoc čerstvú mätu, vanilkový struk či jabĺčka (prípadne sviečky s ich vôňou), ktoré budete mať stále nablízku.
Aj akupresúra pomáha pri akútnych návaloch hladu. Prostredníkom si na 20 až 30 sekúnd stlačte jamku medzi nosom a vrchnou perou a pritom zhlboka dýchajte.
Dávajte si zvlášť pozor na alkohol, niektoré druhy sú veľmi kalorické. Alkohol navyše zabraňuje spaľovaniu tukov. Najlepšie urobíte, ak si budete nalievať iba víno, prípadne víno riedené s perlivou minerálnou vodou.
No a ako vraví známe príslovie Bez práce nie sú koláče, bez toho, aby ste si naplánovali pohyb, by ste na koláčiky nemali ani pozrieť. Stačí ísť do lesa na prechádzku, pokorčuľovať sa na zimnom štadióne či ísť si trocha zabežkovať. Uvidíte, že sa budete omnoho lepšie cítiť .

description.hltext_display: Home for the holidays, sort of
description.content:
Trip to Oakland means going home for several Colts
Written by
Filed Under
colts at
raiders
WISH-8colts at
raiders
Guard Kyle DeVan knew before the release of this season's NFL schedule that the Indianapolis Colts would travel to Oakland. When the actual date -- Sunday, Dec. 26 -- was announced, he wound up with an unexpected trip home for the holidays.
"That made me smile," said DeVan, who grew up near Oakland in Vacaville.
Two other California natives on the Colts, defensive tackle Fili Moala (Buena Park) and cornerback Justin Tryon (Palmdale) are in similar situations.
It means a long, tiring flight across the country on Christmas Day, but also the chance to catch up with family and friends at the team hotel.
"In the NFL, I've never played out West," DeVan said. "This will be a good time. It will be good to get out on the West Coast and see some friendly faces.
"My mom's side of the family is going to come to the hotel. We're going to piece together Christmas dinner. Just for Christmas, it will be like eight people. But for the game, there's no telling. We don't get the greatest tickets -- I'm not getting any of the tickets -- but there's going to be at least 40 or 50 people at the game."
Tryon also will have his own cheering section, but he prefers to focus on the business at hand. Because the Colts (8-6) have a minimal margin for error in an AFC South division title chase with Jacksonville (8-6), he sees this as another playoff game. The Colts can't clinch anything with this game, but they control their own destiny. Win out and they take the division crown and the playoff berth that comes with it.
Moala grew up in the southern part of the state, so this game isn't that close to home.
"It's always good to go home, even if you're seven hours away from home," he said.
"Dad, Mom, sisters, the whole crew, they have to fly up. They will all come to the game. You know how Raiders fans are, I kind of don't want my family to go, but I know they want to come and support."
Moala learned about unruly Raiders fans at an early age.
"The Raiders were in L.A. at the time," he said. "The Raiders and the Rams were there. My dad grew up a Rams fan. I grew up a Rams fan."
Moala and DeVan have told family and friends to be careful. Fans often joke about football being of life-and-death importance, but there is a history of violence in and around Oakland Coliseum.
"I just tell them to stay away from the 'Black Hole.' Just stay away," Moala said of the famed end-zone cheering section, which has the reputation for being filled with the rowdiest fans. "I almost want to tell them to not wear any Colts gear.
"I wouldn't be scared to wear Colts gear in New England, Cleveland or Pittsburgh, but you go to Oakland, it's real over there. You can't do anything but tell your family to be mindful."
DeVan mentioned it, too.
"It's tough going to Oakland," he said. "They're not exactly the nicest fans out there, I'll say that."
A large cheering section wearing Colts gear should translate to strength in numbers.
"I'm just hoping there's enough of them, the bigger the group the less they will stand out individually," DeVan said.
Moala expects just a dozen fans in his family-and-friends group. While it's not something he thought about earlier in the season, he's now looking forward to the weekend.
"Playing football, you don't kind of look at things like that. You look at the next Sunday," he said. "But, yeah, it is special to spend holidays with family."
Added DeVan: "We get to spend an hour or two with them on Christmas Day, then it's time to get down to business."

description.hltext_display: Student-Built Satellite Scheduled For Rocket Launch
description.content:
It was a waiting game not unlike a marriage proposal -- expected, yet unclear in timing. But finally, the CUSat team gets to set a date.
The student team, which has built an experimental satellite equipped with sophisticated GPS technology, has been "manifested" for flight -- that is, the satellite is guaranteed a spot on a rocket bound for space, where it will conduct experiments in low-Earth orbit.
In 2007, CUSat won the U.S. Air Force-sponsored University Nanosatellite Program's Nanosat-4 competition, and the prize was a flight worth millions of dollars. Just recently, their satellite became a confirmed passenger aboard the Falcon 9, which will head to the International Space Station sometime between October 2011 and January 2012.
"We knew we were in the hopper," said Mason Peck, associate professor of mechanical and aerospace engineering and CUSat principal investigator. "It was just a matter of waiting long enough."
Falcon 9 is a rocket built by the company SpaceX, and it will carry routine cargo to the space station during that mission. The payload will be integrated and flown under the management of the Department of Defense Space Test Program.
"The rocket is basically like a subway," said Adam Yozwiak '11, co-team leader. "The SpaceX satellite will get dropped off last at the space station orbit -- we are just hitching a ride on the way."
Since their Nanosat-4 win, the mostly undergraduate student team has been working to improve the software aboard CUSat, which is actually a pair of twin satellites that will separate in space to perform experiments involving orientation and location. The system is capable of circumnavigating space relative to each other, using a code called Carrier-Phase Differential GPS (CDGPS) developed by Mark Psiaki, Cornell professor of mechanical and aerospace engineering. The algorithm he developed is accurate to within centimeters.
"With that type of accuracy, future missions can use the technology to do, for example, close proximity maneuvers," said Mike Goetz '11, co-team leader.
Most or all satellites today use gyroscopes or accelerometers to determine their orientation in space, Yozwiak said. But CUSat can use the CDGPS algorithm to do it autonomously.
The mission will set out to prove the robustness of this new GPS technology, Peck said. "It's very rare for spacecraft to cooperate with each other," he said. "It's usually a cowboy thing -- one spacecraft does its thing. But if you ever hope to have more than one, they have to navigate relative to each other."
These days, the CUSat team spends a lot of time at mission control in Ward Hall. Their satellite has spent the past year at Kirtland Air Force Base in Albuquerque, N.M., for a battery of required environmental tests, which include thermal vacuum chamber testing and vibration testing. These procedures are meant to ensure their hardware will survive the harsh conditions of space.
The team is also busy configuring ground stations that will help them talk to the satellites once they're in orbit. There's one in Ithaca at the Mount Pleasant observatory, and others will be located in the Marshall Islands and in Redondo Beach, Calif.
Another team under Peck is working on a high-agility technology demonstrator satellite called Violet. Violet team members are preparing for the Nanosat-6 competition, and their flight competition review board will meet in January.

description.hltext_display: Hopefuls file for school board vacancies
description.content:
Three Otero County school districts will conduct elections Feb. 1, and only one of those elections will be entirely uncontested.
Tuesday was filing day for the Feb. 1 school board election. People who wanted to run for area school boards had to file their intent to do so by 5 p.m.
In Alamogordo, only one candidate filed for each of three available positions. In District 1, David Borunda will be replacing Susan Medina; in District 3, David Weaver will replace Rhonda Cross; and in District 4, incumbent Allan Rickman will retain his seat.
In Tularosa, running for Doyle Syling's Position 1 seat will be Jeni Alexander and Lillian Duran; Brenda Yousif is uncontested to maintain her Position 3 seat; and in Position 4, Stephanie DuBois will running against incumbent Michael Mackechnie.
Cloudcroft will have the hottest competition with Charliss Randall running against incumbent Doug Porch for Position 1; Arlan Ponder running against Harold Woten for Position 2; and a race between Gerald Green, Denton Schilling and Robert Dulaney Barrett for Position 3 being vacated by Terry Buttram.
Ponder said he is running as a parent of two girls in the school system.
"Everybody wants to make a change," Ponder said. "I just want to make sure we are providing the kids with the best education they can get."
DuBois said she has nothing against Mackechnie because she doesn't know him.
"I'm a member of the community," DuBois said. "I have a small business, and if I can give back to
the community, that's a good thing."
DuBois said she feels like the election is also about the process and "I feel like, 'Don't let them run free.'"
Contact Elva K Osterreich at eosterreich@alamogordonews.com.

description.hltext_display: Oorlogswinter in Amerikaanse bioscopen
description.content:
� Vragen over frequenties of andere vragen? Scne uit Oorlogswinter. ANP
LOS ANGELES (ANP) – De Nederlandse film Oorlogswinter van regisseur Martin Koolhoven gaat half maart draaien in de Amerikaanse bioscopen. Dat heeft de Amerikaanse distributeur Sony Pictures Classics gemeld op zijn website.
Oorlogswinter is de verfilming van het gelijknamige boek van Jan Terlouw over de 14-jarige Michiel (Martijn Lakemeier) die met zijn familie probeert de laatste winter van de Tweede Wereldoorlog te overleven. De film trok in Nederland rond de 850.000 bezoekers.
De Nederlandse film werd begin 2010 aangekocht door Sony toen hij op een shortlist stond voor de Oscar voor beste buitenlandse productie. Uiteindelijk sleepte Oorlogswinter geen nominatie in de wacht. De productie werd ook verkocht aan onder meer Australië, Ierland, Engeland, Duitsland, Nieuw-Zeeland, Frankrijk, Oostenrijk en China. � Om reacties te kunnen plaatsen moet je ingelogd zijn. Ga naar 'Mijn BNR' om in te loggen.
Stuur uw nieuws of aanvulling (commentaar, foto, video) naar de BNR Nieuwsradio redactie
Hier kunt u inloggen op 'Mijn BNR'. Indien u nog niet geregistreerd bent, kunt u zich hier registreren. .

description.hltext_display: HTC Wildfire: Update auf Android 2.2
description.content:
HTC und Vodafone bieten Froyo an
Sowohl HTC als auch Vodafone bieten das Froyo-Update für das HTC Wildfire an. Damit können Nutzer jetzt Android 2.2 auf ihrem Smartphone nutzen. Die neue Firmware wird dabei "Over The Air" auf das Smartphone gespielt.
HTC Wildfire: Besitzer dieses Smartphones können sich über ein Froyo-Update freuen. (Bild: netzwelt)
Während HTC das Froyo-Update für das Desire bereits im August herausgebracht hat, mussten Nutzer eines HTC Legend noch bis letzte Woche warten. Das HTC Wildfire kann dagegen seit gestern auch auf Android 2.2 aufgerüstet werden. Dabei geht es um die ungebrandeten Smartphone-Varianten.
Legend, Magic und Wildfire mit Froyo bei Vodafone
Wer ein HTC Wildfire mit Vodafene-Branding besitzt kann sich ebenfalls über ein Froyo-Update freuen. Seit kurzem bietet Vodafone auch für das HTC Magic Android 2.2 an. Beim HTC Legend war Vodafone schneller als HTC und so wird für dieses Modell das Update bereits seit gut einem Monat angeboten.
Froyo wurde von Google im Mai vorgestellt. Im Vergleich zu Android 2.1 soll sich die Version 2.2 vor allem in Sachen Geschwindigkeit verbessert haben. Der Aufruf einer Webseite wird durch eine überarbeitete Javascrip-Engine schneller. Außerdem unterstützt der Browser unter Froyo erstmals die Wiedergabe von Flash-Inhalten. Ebenfalls neu im Vergleich zum Vorgänger ist die Tethering-Funktion. Dadurch kann das Smartphone als WLan-Hotspot verwendet werden.
Gingerbread ist die aktuellste Version
Allerdings ist Froyo nicht die akutellste Android-Version. Gingerbread wurde Anfang Dezember von Google vorgestellt. In der neuen Version 2.3 wurde die Oberfläche erneuert, wodurch die Bedienung intuitiver werden soll. Unter anderem wurde dabei die virtuelle Tastatur überarbeitet.
Darüber hinaus wurden neue Techniken eingebaut, wie zum Beispiel Near Field Communication. Außerdem wurde das Betriebssystem wieder einmal beschleunigt und für das mobile Spielen optimiert. Wer sich eine Übersicht über alle verfügbaren Android-Versionen verschaffen will, kann sich im Android Update-Guide von netzwelt informieren.

description.hltext_display: Steve Landesberg, aka Detective Arthur Deitrich, passes away
description.content:
A CYNOPSIS MESSAGE FROM CBS COLLEGE SPORTS NETWORK
CBS COLLEGE SPORTS NETWORK is available to 94 million homes nationwide!
We congratulate Army, Navy and Air Force on their record-breaking 2010 seasons!
INDIANA HOOSIERS fans EVERYWHERE can watch their men's hoops team TONIGHT vs. N. Iowa at 7:30 ET (12/23, too)
Cynopsis
Good morning. It's Wednesday, December 22, 2010, and this is your first early morning briefing. As always, if you prefer to watch this morning's news instead of reading it, click here .
Tonight's Finales:
TLC: Untold Stories of the E.R. at 9p
USA Network: Psych at 10p
Yesterday, the FCC passed the net neutrality regulations by a 3-2 vote after FCC Chairman Julius Genachowski obtained the backing of the agency's two Democratic commissioners on Monday. The new regulations will take effect early next year and are designed to guarantee broadband web users equal access to all websites, online services and applications and prohibits internet service providers from blocking sites. Genachowski said yesterday's vote by the FCC was historic. "For the first time we'll have enforceable rules of the road to preserve Internet freedom and openness," said Genachowski. President Obama also hailed the FCC's vote as a benchmark, saying the government would "remain vigilant and see to it that innovation is allowed to flourish, that consumers are protected from abuse, and that the democratic spirit of the Internet remains intact."
Military Channel opens the new action series Greatest Tank Battles on January 5 at 10p. During 10 one-hour episodes, the series goes on location to battlefields around the world and uses realistic CGI animation to recreate the military maneuvers used in historic tank battles over the last century. The series is produced for Military Channel by Breakthrough Entertainment.
Current TV announced its community-developed original drama series Bar Karma from video game designer Will Wright (The Sims, SimCity) and Worldwide Biggies' CEO Albie Hecht is set to debut February 11 at 10p. The 12-episode series, for the first time, allows viewers the chance to control plots, characters and overall development of the series before it airs by utilizing the Storymaker application that is available online at current.com/studios or via the new iPhone App out this week. The series is shot in New York and action is set at a mystical bar at the edge of the universe with the plot taking shape around the scenario: "A guy or gal walks into a bar ..." The series stars William Sanderson, Matthew Humphreys and Cassie Howarth. Leading up to Bar Karma's February 11 premiere, Current TV is airing a half-hour special, TV You Control: Bar Karma on January 20 at 8p hosted by Matthew Humphreys. The special offers viewers a behind-the-scenes exclusive tour of how viewers can participate in the drama with interviews with the show's cast and creators.
FX is bringing back a sophomore season of its drama series Justified on February 9 at 10p. The 13-week series stars Timothy Olyphant and is based on the works by crime writer Elmore Leonard. Graham Yost developed the series that is produced by Sony Pictures Television and FX Productions.
A new season of Dangerous Encounters joins the lineup on Nat Geo WILD starting January 4 at 9p. The series, with five new episodes, follows professional herpetologist Dr. Brady Barr as he takes on some of the most dangerous creatures on earth.
All-new, one-hour episodes of Kimora: Life in the Fab Lane premieres January 9 at 9p on The Style Network. The docu-series' new season continues to highlight the business and personal life of fashion guru, model and mom Kimora Lee Simmons. Left/Right produces the series for The Style Network.
Planet Green launches a second season of Conviction Kitchen on January 14 at 10p. During the new season, executive chef Marc Thuet and his wife/business partner, Biana Zorich work with ex-cons and recovering drug addicts, who have no culinary experience, as they race against time to open a new restaurant. The eight-episode Conviction Kitchen is produced by Cineflix Inc. for Planet Green.
The Style Network's third season finale of Giuliana & Bill on Monday at 8p delivered a 0.87 rating with W18-49 and tallied more than 600,000 total viewers.
Steve Landesberg, best known as playing Detective Arthur Dietrich on the mid-1970s television series Barney Miller, died yesterday morning in Los Angeles. He was 65. In addition to playing Det. Dietrich on Barney Miller, which ran on ABC from 1975-1982, Mr. Landesberg had a dual role on the show also playing Father Paul. Mr. Landesberg received three Emmy nominations for his work on Barney Miller during the last three years of the show's run. In more recent years, Mr. Landesberg appeared in such feature films as Forgetting Sarah Marshall and Wild Hogs as well as the Starz series Head Case from 2007-2009. Furthermore, he appeared in the 2002 television series Harvey Birdman, Attorney at Law and had recurring roles on Harry and the Henderson and The Golden Girls and guest starred in several others including Seinfeld, Law and Order, Cosby, Ghost Whisperer and Everybody Hates Chris. Mr. Landesberg also hosted a special for NBC in 1983 titled The Steve Landesberg Show. He had the distinction of being discovered at an open audition hosted by Bill Cosby for NBC's The Tonight Show which led to stints at the Improv working with David Brenner, Jimmie Walker and Bette Midler. Mr. Landesberg also did voiceover gigs for animated series including American Dad, appeared on regional stage shows and in numerous TV commercials. He is survived by his wife, Nancy and a daughter.
Program Call: Cynopsis Media will be producing our annual NATPE Shopping Guide sent to all Cynopsis and Cynopsis Kids subscribers on Thursday, January 20, the week before NATPE 2011 in Miami. If you would like to have your programming included, please send us only the following info for your top 5 shows: title, availability date, number of episodes, length, type (i.e., movie, series, special, etc.), genre and your terms (barter, cash, etc.) as well as your company's stand/booth location. To be included in this free and highly-viewed special edition, please send your submission to lisa@cynopsis.com no later than Friday, January 14, 2011. A confirmation email will be sent following each submission from Lisa (if you don't receive a confirmation email, please resubmit).

Merry Christmas | Happy Holidays | Happy New Year
Cyn opsis Media will be off the week of December 27 - 31, 2010.
Don't forget to read the 2010 Year in Review on January 1st 2011!
Past e-publications, classifieds & industry calendar of events can always be found on our website.
Spanish-language network Mexicanal Network picked up new station affiliates in Texas and Nevada adding KVAT-LD in Austin and KELM-LP in Reno effective immediately to its roster. Mexicanal's digital broadcast distribution also includes affiliates in Los Angeles, San Diego, Tucson, Palm Springs, Oklahoma City, Boise, Twin Falls and Yakima.
Interviewer/talk show host Tavis Smiley is switching his co-producer for his weeknight PBS talk show, Tavis Smiley to WNET.ORG in New York. Previously, Smiley co-produced his show with KCET-TV in Los Angeles, though that station has decided to end its affiliation with PBS as of January 1. Smiley made a one-year deal with WNET which also allows WNET to oversee the show's website, outreach to schools, work with other PBS stations to secure time slots and help with fundraising even for Smiley's primetime specials. The half-hour Tavis Smiley will launch its eighth season in January and will continue to be taped at rented studios at KCET-TV in Los Angeles, though Smiley will now have access to WNET's studio at Lincoln Center. In the LA area, Smiley's show will air on KOCE-TV beginning in January.
OWN: Oprah Winfrey Network said Gayle King and HLN anchor Robin Meade will moderate the four two-hour primetime specials, Ask Oprah's All Stars featuring Dr. Phil McGraw, Dr. Mehmet Oz and Suze Orman as they answer viewer questions. The first of four specials premieres on January 2 at 8p and the subsequent specials air on consecutive Sundays on January 9, 16 and 23 at 8p. Meade will moderate the specials airing on January 2 and January 16 while King moderates on January 9 and January 23. Also The Gayle King Show will now debut a week later on January 10 at 10a since King is moderating the specials taping in Los Angeles during the week of January 2.

Saturday A18-49 Analysis: FOX held onto its lead Saturday night with a 1.5/5 among A18-49, according to final national ratings from Nielsen. At 8p, FOX was well ahead of the pack with its back-to-back Cops episodes at an average of 1.5/5 followed by CBS' Crimetime Saturday repeat edition at 0.8/3. All was steady-eddy for FOX at 9p as AMW: America Fights Back was #1 at 1.5/5 and ABC's encore movie presentation was next at 1.0/4. Then at 10p, ABC's movie and CBS' rerun of 48 Hours Mystery shared #1 at 1.2/4 each and NBC's Law & Order: SVU repeat and Univision's Sabado Gigante tied for #2 at 0.9/3 each.

CBS opened the night a winner during 7p with 60 Minutes at 4.0/12 and NBC's Football Night in America Part 2 and Part 3 averaged a second place at 3.0/9. At 8p, NBC won with a combination of Football Night in America Part 3, Sunday Night NFL Pre-Kick and the Sunday Night Football which averaged a 5.8/16 followed by CBS with the remainder of 60 Minutes and the Survivor: Nicaragua Finale with an average of 4.1/11. NBC surpassed the competition at 9p with its Sunday Night Football match at 8.4/21 while CBS' Survivor: Nicaragua Finale was #2 at 4.1/10. Turner Sports Ad Sales tapped Will Blair as SVP/Sponsorships and Sales. Will joins from Cartoon Network and Adult Swim where he served as VP/Brand Activation and Media Partnerships. In his new capacity, Will now manages custom branded promotional initiatives for advertising clients involving the NBA, NASCAR, MLB, professional golf and the NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Tournament. Based in New York, Will reports to Jon Diament, EVP, Turner Sports Ad Sales and Marketing.
Lee Flaster was elevated to SVP/Planning, Strategy and Business Operations for Telemundo Ad Sales. Lee's scope of duties include working with business entities to develop business strategies and partnerships in order to spur added revenue for the networks encompassing Telemundo, Telemundo stations, mun2 and Telemundo Digital. Lee reports to Jacqueline Hernandez, COO, Telemundo and to Ed Swindler, EVP/COO, Ad Sales at NBC Universal.
TV advertising network, REVShare upped Michael Montgomery to VP/Ad Sales. Michael will handle national clients while based at the company's Temecula, CA headquarters.
As of January 3, Beth Fetzer joins ArnoldNYC as SVP/Director of Integrated Planning where she will spearhead the agency's integrated planning unit that offers business insights, consumer insight and digital strategy integration. Beth will report to Lynn Power, President, ArnoldNYC.
This day in History: 1976 - The last show of the original Let's Make A Deal aired.

I reached for the last one they had, but so did another man. As I rained blows upon him, I realized there had to be another way." description.hltext_display: Lebenslange Haft: Bestatter erschlägt Frau mit Holzscheit
description.author: dpa-lby
description.content:
49-jähriger Mann aus Selb verbrannte Ehefrau im Wald - Zuvor neue Frau kennengelernt - vor 2 Minuten
Hof/Selb - Wegen Mordes an seiner Ehefrau ist ein Bestatter am Mittwoch vom Landgericht Hof zu einer lebenslangen Freiheitsstrafe verurteilt worden.
Der Angeklagte hat die tödlichen Schläge gegen seine Ehefrau gestanden.
Foto: dpa
Der Angeklagte hat die tödlichen Schläge gegen seine Ehefrau gestanden.
Foto: dpa
Nach Überzeugung des Gerichts hatte der 49-Jährige seine Frau Ende Oktober des vergangenen Jahres im Keller des gemeinsamen Hauses in Selb mit einem Holzscheit erschlagen. Anschließend schaffte er die Leiche der 50-Jährigen in den Wald und zündete sie an. Der Angeklagte hatte wenige Monate zuvor eine junge Frau kennengelernt, mit der er ein neues Leben beginnen wollte. Zudem wollte er mit dem Hausverkauf und dem Geld aus der Lebensversicherung seine finanziellen Probleme lösen.

description.hltext_display: Eindhoven Airport: recordaantal passagiers
description.content:
� Vragen over frequenties of andere vragen? ANP
EINDHOVEN (AFN) – Eindhoven Airport heeft dit jaar de grens van twee miljoen passagiers doorbroken. Dit jaar vlogen 2,14 miljoen passagiers van en naar Eindhoven Airport. Dat is een kwart meer dan in 2009 (1.712.000). Dat liet de regionale luchthaven woensdag weten.
Volgens de regionale luchthaven is een toename van het aantal nieuwe bestemmingen de belangrijkste oorzaak van de groei. Vanaf Eindhoven Airport kan worden gevlogen naar 32 lijndienstbestemmingen. Eind 2009 waren dat er nog 23.
Voor volgend jaar verwacht Eindhoven Airport 15 procent meer passagiers te vervoeren. � Om reacties te kunnen plaatsen moet je ingelogd zijn. Ga naar 'Mijn BNR' om in te loggen.
Stuur uw nieuws of aanvulling (commentaar, foto, video) naar de BNR Nieuwsradio redactie
Hier kunt u inloggen op 'Mijn BNR'. Indien u nog niet geregistreerd bent, kunt u zich hier registreren. .

description.content: MADRID, 22 (EUROPA PRESS) El Sorteo Extraordinario de la Lotería de Navidad ha comenzado esta mañana a las 9.19 horas, con unos minutos de retraso. Este año se repartirán 2.320 millones de euros en premios.

description.hltext_display: There are many online websites offering designer shoes
description.content: Where to find wholesale? wholesale. I would like to share my favorite shopping sites with you. Cendaktrading.com offers many kinds of shoes wholesale such as basketball shoes; Obama shoes wholesale, wholesale Gucci shoes, timberland shoes, etc. Now Nike Shox has become a relatively mature product type, the technology of Shox is related with cushioning, or shock absorption. Besides, the cushion set in the midsoles of the sports shoes, like a spring, will spring the runner back and add more power to him or her. For Instance:- The PUMA v5.08 IT Indoor Soccer Shoe The upper of the shoe has a soft mesh with synthetic leather overlay, which gives good contact. The shoe has central lacing and a soft nylon ankle lining, The outsole of the shoe is made of rubber, that has been specifically designed for use on indoor pitches.

description.hltext_display: [社会]サイトで節約術を交換、「ネット家計簿」が人気
description.content:
パソコンや携帯電話からインターネットに接続して使う「ネット家計簿」の利用者が増えている。従来の家計簿ソフトと同様に出費を管理できることに加え、会員同士がサイトで節約術を情報交換するオンラインならではの特徴が人気を呼んでいる。「ネット家計簿ココマネ」を運営するＮＴＴメディアサプライによると、ココマネを含むネット家計簿市場全体の利用者はことし12月時点で推定約43万人。半年で約9万人増加した。
（情報提供：共同通信社）

description.hltext_display: Census: New Mexico hits 2 million
description.content:
ALBUQUERQUE - Congratulations, New Mexico. U.S. Census Bureau figures released Tuesday show the state's population has grown to more than 2 million residents in the last decade.
The 2010 Census data listed New Mexico's population at 2,059,179 residents, reflecting a 13.2 percent increase over the population in 2000, which was 1,819,046.
While the growth wasn't enough to help New Mexico secure a fourth seat in the U.S. House, the state won't lose any seats, either.
The population growth rate over the past decade was slower than it has been historically and one of the lowest in state history. By contrast, New Mexico saw a 20.1 percent population increase from 1990 to 2000, 16.3 percent from 1980 to 1990 and 28.2 percent from 1970 to 1980.
"We're seeing a slower rate of growth than in past decades, but that is similar to the nation as a whole and in many other states," Albuquerque pollster Brian Sanderoff said.
Sanderoff said for New Mexico and the nation, that's mostly because the economy has slowed in recent years.
If there's a silver lining in the New Mexico data, Sanderoff said it's that the 13.2 growth rate was higher than the 10.5 percent figure the Census Bureau had projected.
"So our growth rate is a little higher than expected," he said.
The United States population grew by 9.7 percent to 308.7 million.
Neighboring states saw increases, with Texas gaining four House seats after a 20.6 percent growth rate over the past 10 years increased its population
to more than 25,145,000. Arizona gained a seat, too, with a 24.6 percent growth rate that pushed the state's population to more than 6,390,000 residents.
The 13.2 percent rate of increase in New Mexico followed a trend that showed 13.8 percent growth among Western states.
The next round of Census data, to be released beginning in February, will detail population and race breakdowns to the neighborhood level. That information is used to help states redraw congressional boundaries and legislative districts.
