description.hltext_display: Boys Basketball: Franklin's Kessler a cardiac kid
description.author: Staff reports
description.content:
Senior guard Tyler Kessler buried two 3-pointers within 1.7 seconds to play as Franklin came from behind to take a thrilling 79-78 decision from Hockomock League host Stoughton in overtime.
Down five points with 1.7 seconds to go, Kessler hit a 3-pointer to bring Franklin within two. After a timeout, Jeremiah Moynihan stole the inbounds pass and found an open Kessler for the buzzer-beating game-winner.
Kyle Gibson had 37 points and 15 rebounds for the Panthers (3-0, 2-0 Hockomock).
Tim Garvey (9 points) hit three 3-pointers and Jason Mckie chipped in with solid defense for the Panthers.
WAYLAND 63, BEDFORD 38: Senior center Jay Saltmarsh dropped 22 points and hauled in 12 rebounds to help Wayland to a Dual County League Small win over host Bedford.
Leading 18-17 at halftime, Wayland used a 24-7 run in the third quarter to pull away.
Guards Ben Shelton (12 points, 4 assists) and Dan Lesser (5 points, 7 assists) played well for the Warriors (2-1, 1-0 DCL Small).
WESTFORD 65, LINCOLN-SUDBURY 58: The Warriors couldn't stop Westford's Mark Cornelious (24 points, 18 rebounds) as the Grey Ghosts downed Lincoln-Sudbury in Dual County League Large action.
WELLESLEY 54, DEDHAM 36: Blake Dowling scored a team-high 14 points as Wellesley jumped to an early 15-0 lead in the first quarter and cruised past Bay State Conference foe Dedham.
The Raiders (2-0 overall, BSC) also got strong games from Armand Menegay (12 points, 5 rebounds, 2 assists), Duncan Johnson (10 points, 2 rebounds) and Cooper Ainge (9 points, 5 assists).
The entire Raider defense played a solid game, holding Dedham to 14 points combined during three of the four quarters of play.
WALPOLE 48, NATICK 45 (OT): Andrew Siden had 14 points but Natick lost a back-and-forth Bay State Conference tilt to Walpole.
The game was locked at 41 all heading into overtime. Lincoln Zernicke (7 points) and James Levine (12 points) also played well for the Red and Blue (0-2 BSC).
WEYMOUTH 69, FRAMINGHAM 54: Senior guard Sam Searcy put forth an outstanding effort but it wasn't enough as host Framingham dropped this Bay State Conference tilt to Weymouth.
Leading 34-29 at the half, the Flyers (0-2 overall, BSC) couldn't find any rhythm on offense in the second half.
Greg Finley and Kevin Murphy also played well for the Flyers.
HOPKINTON 67, HOLLISTON 46: Junior point guard Barrett Hanlon netted 15 points and handed out four assists to lead Hopkinton to a Tri-Valley League victory over visiting Holliston.
Will Relle collected 10 points and 10 rebounds, Jason Dlugolecki scored nine points, and Wesley Ericksen and Tommy Hennigan each tallied eight points for Hopkinton (3-0), which led 17-11 after one quarter, 36-22 at halftime and 58-33 after three.
Malcolm Navarro and Christian Baker scored 10 points apiece, and Sam Gillespie added eight points for Holliston (1-1).
DOVER-SHERBORN 71, BELLINGHAM 58: Nate Jenkins scored 18 points and grabbed five rebounds to lead visiting Dover-Sherborn past Bellingham in a Tri-Valley League matchup.
Ned Linehan scored 12 points and Glen Krebs added 10 points for D-S (2-1), which led 39-23 at the half and 54-43 after three quarters.
R.J. Lynch scored nine of his 12 points in the third as Bellingham cut the D-S lead to six. Nick White led Bellingham (1-2) with 14 points.
MILLIS 68, WESTWOOD 56: Senior guard Kyle Latosek scored 17 points to help Millis beat host Westwood in Tri-Valley League action.
The Mohawks (1-1 overall, TVL) got a solid performance from senior forward Alex Lagos (12 points, 7 rebounds, 4 steals, 2 blocks).
Jamie Davis (16 points) and Chris Baker (13 points, 6 rebounds, 6 steals) also played well for the Mohawks.
NORTON 44, ASHLAND 30: Junior point guard Tim Juitt scored 14 points to lead Ashland, but Norton snapped a tie with a 16-2 run in the fourth quarter quarter to down the Clockers in a Tri-Valley League game.
Ashland (0-3) led 15-13 at the half. The game was tied 28-28 after three.
LOWELL CATHOLIC 44, MARIAN 39: Senior Frankie Bratica had 18 points, but Marian fell to Lowell Catholic in Catholic Central Small play.
Junior Trevor Rabidou had eight points and five steals, while sophomore Charlie Durkin added six points for the Mustangs (1-4, 0-2 CCS).
Freshman Benjamin Crawford had a notable game for Marian, coming off the bench to play center and pulling down seven rebounds while netting four points in addition to two steals and two blocks.
HUDSON 52, AUBURN 45: Jake Loewen had 25 points, including 19 in the fourth quarter, as Hudson recovered from a seven-point deficit entering the fourth quarter to pick up a non-league win over Auburn.
Bob Brisbois had 12 rebounds while Nate Bigely, Eric Davis and Dillon Glynn all had strong efforts for the Hawks (3-1). Hudson trailed 27-19 at the half.
MAYNARD 57, LITTLETON 37: Kyle Howes led all scorers with 25 points as Maynard cruised to a non-league win over Littleton. Ben Chiasson had 12 points and 12 rebounds while Ryan Fowler added eight points and 12 boards for the Tigers (1-2).
CLINTON 63, ASSABET 31: Senior center Kevin Boucher had eight points and 16 rebounds but Assabet fell to Clinton in non-league action. The Aztecs fall to 0-3.

description.hltext_display: Snow in Europe causes cancelled flights and EU concern
description.content: The snow in Europe is still causing chaos for travellers, including many Australians trying to get home for Christmas. The European Commission has called a meeting with airport officials to look at new ways of dealing with extreme weather. Two of the world's busiest airports - Heathrow and Frankfurt - have been among the worst affected.

description.hltext_display: Bayerisches Kabinett beschließt Doppelhaushalt
description.author: dapd
description.content:
Etat für 2011 und 2012 sieht sieht Ausgaben von fast 86 Milliarden Euro vor – Scharfe Kritik von der Opposition - vor 38 Minuten
München - Das bayerische Kabinett hat einen 85,8 Milliarden Euro schweren Doppelhaushalt für die kommenden beiden Jahre beschlossen. Dies sei das höchste Ausgabenniveau, das es in der Geschichte des Freistaats je gegeben habe, sagte Ministerpräsident Horst Seehofer (CSU) in München. Dennoch komme man erneut ohne neue Schulden aus – das sechste und siebte Jahr in Folge. Für 2011 sind Ausgaben von 42,7 Milliarden Euro vorgesehen, für 2012 von 43,1 Milliarden Euro.
Ministerpräsident Horst Seehofer (Mitte), Finanzminister Georg Fahrenschon (beide CSU) und Wirtschaftsminister Martin Zeil (FDP, links im Bild) auf einer Pressekonferenz zum neu beschlossenen Doppelhaushalt in der Staatskanzlei in München. Es soll kräftig gespart werden, vor allem bei den Beamten - diese sollen 2011 eine Nullrunde in Kauf nehmen müssen.
Foto: dpa
Ministerpräsident Horst Seehofer (Mitte), Finanzminister Georg Fahrenschon (beide CSU) und Wirtschaftsminister Martin Zeil (FDP, links im Bild) auf einer Pressekonferenz zum neu beschlossenen Doppelhaushalt in der Staatskanzlei in München. Es soll kräftig gespart werden, vor allem bei den Beamten - diese sollen 2011 eine Nullrunde in Kauf nehmen müssen.
Foto: dpa
Gegenüber dem ursprünglich erwarteten Bedarf habe man im Doppelhaushalt 1,8 Milliarden Euro gespart, erklärte die Staatskanzlei. Finanzminister Georg Fahrenschon (CSU) sprach von erheblichen Umschichtungen und schmerzlichen Einsparungen über alle Ressorts hinweg. Besonders betroffen sei der Personalsektor, der über die beiden Jahre mehr als 900 Millionen Euro einbringen müsse. Der Rest sei in den Ressorts eingespart worden.
Steigerung bei Ausgaben für Familien und Bildung
Trotz der Einsparungen sollen die Ausgaben für Familien von derzeit 2,0 Milliarden Euro auf 2,1 Milliarden Euro im kommenden Jahr und 2,2 Milliarden Euro im Jahr 2012 steigen. Die Ausgaben für Schule, Hochschule und Wissenschaft liegen laut Finanzministerium in den Jahren 2011 und 2012 bei jeweils 15,3 Milliarden Euro und damit 300 Millionen Euro höher als 2010. Teil des Doppelhaushalts sind auch Zinszahlungen für die Stabilisierungsaufwendungen für die Landesbank in Höhe von 659,8 Millionen Euro. Diese werden laut Finanzministerium aus Rücklagen bezahlt. Seehofer betonte, man habe nicht wegen der Landesbank sparen müssen. Der Haushalt muss nun noch vom Landtag beschlossen werden.
Von der Opposition kam scharfe Kritik am Haushaltsentwurf. Die SPD warf der Regierung Etikettenschwindel vor. Der haushalts- und finanzpolitischen Sprecher der SPD-Landtagsfraktion, Volkmar Halbleib, sagte, das Haushalts-Paket habe zwar eine schöne glänzende Verpackung, es enthalte aber „Kürzungen und Ungerechtigkeiten, ist an vielen Stellen durch den Landesbank-Virus befallen und vom Steuerfraß geschädigt.“ Der Etatentwurf sei ein vergiftetes Weihnachtsgeschenk.
Grüne kritisieren „Märchen vom ausgeglichenen Haushalt“
Die haushaltspolitische Sprecherin der Grünen, Claudia Stamm, kritisierte, die Staatsregierung erzähle alle zwei Jahre wieder das Märchen vom ausgeglichenen Haushalt. Die Realität sehe aber leider anders aus. Immer wieder hätten in den vergangenen Jahren Haushaltslöcher mit Krediten, Privatisierungserlösen und Rücklagen gedeckt werden müssen.
Freie-Wähler-Chef Hubert Aiwanger monierte: „Dieser angeblich ausgeglichene Haushalt ist Makulatur.“ Schulden würden auf die Kommunen verlagert und Strukturen kaputtgespart. „Staatsstraßen vergammeln, für die Alterssicherung der Beamten wird kein Geld zurückgelegt – das ist unsolide und ein vergiftetes Erbe für die nächste Generation.“
Kritik vom Beamtenbund
Kritik kam auch vom Bayerischen Beamtenbund (BBB), der bei den Sparmaßnahmen ein deutliches Ungleichgewicht zulasten der Beamten monierte. Man könne kein Verständnis für Sparmaßnahmen erwarten, wenn man nur an einer Ecke spare, an der anderen aber völlig undifferenziert das Geld unter die Leute bringe.

description.hltext_display: DSIยันต้องค้านประกันตัวผู้ต้องหาคดีร้ายแรง
description.content:
อธิบดีดีเอสไอเผยการคัดค้านประกันตัวเสื้อแดงหรือไม่ ต้องพิจารณารอบคอบ
วันนี้ 22 ธ.ค.ผู้สื่อข่าวรายงานว่า นายธาริต เพ็งดิษฐ์ อธิบดีกรมสอบสวนคดีพิเศษ(ดีเอสไอ) กล่าวถึง การอนุมัติให้ประกันแกนนำเสื้อแดง 7 คนว่า ที่ผ่านมาดีเอสไอได้คัดค้านการประกันตัวมาตลอด แต่เมื่อมีการร้องทุกข์เพื่อขอให้มีการปล่อยตัวชั่วคราว ในส่วนของดีเอสไอก็จะเรียกประชุมพนักงานสอบสวนเพื่อหารืออีกครั้งหนึ่ง เพราะสถานการณ์ได้เปลี่ยนแปลงไปแล้ว อย่างไรก็ตาม คณะรัฐมนตรี(ครม.)ไม่ได้มีมติให้อำนวยความสะดวกในการประกันตัวแนวร่วมนปช.ทั้ง 104 ราย ดังนั้น ดีเอสไอ อัยการ และสำนักงานตำรวจแห่งชาติ(สตช.) จะต้องพิจารณาร่วมกัน ถึงพฤติการณ์ในการกระทำความผิดของผู้ต้องหาทั้งหมด เพราะบางรายอาทิ นายพิเชษฐ์ สุขจินดาทอง การ์ดนปช.กลุ่มลูกน้องพล.ต.ขัตติยะ สวัสดิผล หรือเสธ.แดง ซึ่งต้องคดีก่อการร้ายแต่มีรายชื่ออยู่ในข่ายเสนอให้ได้รับการประกันตัว เนื่องจากการตรวจสอบความผิดในคดีเล็กน้อยพบรายชื่อซึ่งเป็นเพียงการตรวจสอบเบื้องต้นของกรมคุ้มครองสิทธิและเสรี� าพเท่านั้น ดังนั้น ดีเอสไอจึงต้องพิจารณาข้อมูลให้ครบถ้วน ขณะนี้ยืนยันว่ายังมีความจำเป็นต้องคัดค้านการประกันตัวผู้ต้องหาคดีก่อการร้ายที่อยู่ในกลุ่มก่อการร้ายและคีย์แมนระดับมันสมอง.

description.hltext_display: Boil Notice Issued In Co Limerick
description.content: Limerick County Council, following consultation with the HSE, has issued a public water boil notice to customers served by the Abbeyfeale Water Scheme over fears that that the drinking water may be contaminated.

description.hltext_display: Deutsche Bank muss Millionen zahlen
description.content: New York/Frankfurt (dpa) - Die USA haben die Deutsche Bank für ihre Beteiligung an illegalen Steuersparmodellen zur Rechenschaft gezogen. Das Frankfurter Geldhaus willigte ein, knapp 554 Millionen Dollar an den amerikanischen Fiskus zu zahlen.

description.hltext_display: Richarlyson espera manter trajetória vitoriosa conquistando títulos pelo Galo
description.content:
Campeão mundial e tricampeão brasileiro por seu ex-clube, o volante Richarlyson chega ao Atlético disposto a manter, com a camisa alvinegra, a sua trajetória vitoriosa na carreira.
“Felicidade por estar sendo contratado por uma equipe de qualificação tão grande quanto a minha anterior e espero continuar minha história vitoriosa conquistando títulos, alcançando objetivos individuais e tendo a ambição, sempre, de fazer o melhor pelo Atlético”, disse o meio-campista, que também falou sobre o que representa para ele vestir a camisa do Galo.
“Representa muita coisa para mim, sabedor da torcida apaixonante que move esse clube e da disposição que o presidente Alexandre Kalil teve para me contratar. Então, é um mix de emoção com ansiedade de logo poder trabalhar como atleta do Galo. Espero dar conta do recado e que a torcida esteja na mesma euforia que estou para começar a trabalhar aqui no Atlético”, comentou.
Richarlyson afirmou que a Massa Atleticana verá um jogador bastante aguerrido em campo. “A torcida pode esperar um jogador sempre guerreiro, motivador e com espírito de liderança. Espero fazer tudo de bom para o Atlético, com a ajuda dos meus companheiros, para que a gente possa, junto com o professor Dorival, alcançar o objetivo maior que é a conquista de títulos”, destacou.
O volante concluiu dizendo que as conversas com Diego Tardelli e Zé Luis foram determinantes para sua vinda ao Galo.
“O Tardelli e o Zé Luis foram duas pessoas que me ajudaram a tomar essa decisão de assinar com o Atlético. Eles falaram muito bem sobre a estrutura e as ambições que o clube tem e isso foi de suma importância para que, hoje, eu esteja falando como jogador do Atlético”.

description.hltext_display: Greens cynical about radioactive report
description.content:
Conservationists and the Australian Greens are cynical about the timing of a report giving the thumbs up for draft laws to establish a radioactive waste dump.
Energy Minister Martin Ferguson introduced the draft laws to parliament earlier this year, saying they would ensure the safe management of medical, industrial and research radioactive material.
A lower house committee was formed to examine the National Radioactive Waste Management Bill 2010 and tabled its report on Wednesday, recommending they be passed.
The laws would allow a site to be established anywhere in Australia rather than just the Northern Territory, overriding state and territory laws.
Muckaty Station, near Tennant Creek, is one of the sites the federal government has considered after it was volunteered by a branch of the Ngapa tribe in 2007.
But traditional owners of the site have taken their fight against the waste dump to the Federal Court.
The Australian Greens have described the process as a whitewash.
Greens MP Adam Bandt said the lower house committee had refused to hear from the public or the area's traditional owners.
The committee's report says the issue has been the subject of earlier inquiries, including a Senate committee, and there have been opportunities for comment in those hearings.
"This is Martin Ferguson's appalling Christmas present for the people of Muckaty," Mr Bandt said.
The radioactive waste is now stored in suburban and regional areas across the nation under less than ideal management regimes, according to Mr Ferguson.
About 4000 cubic metres of low-level and shortlived intermediate-level radioactive waste has accumulated in Australia in the past 50 years.
Mr Bandt said the report asked Mr Ferguson to meet the traditional owners - but so far he hadn't.
"The traditional owners of the proposed waste dump site, Muckaty Station, have also written to him requesting that he meet with them," Mr Bandt said.
"Martin Ferguson has ignored them.
"Instead of asking why or inviting the traditional owners to appear before the committee, the house committee chose not to receive any public submissions or any new information."
The draft laws would override the wishes of traditional owners, said Mr Bandt who, as a member of the committee, gave a dissenting report.
He said it was interesting the report was tabled while parliament was not sitting and just three days before Christmas.
Australian Conservation Foundation spokesman Dave Sweeney said the committee process was a quick and dirty attempt to solve a long and dirty problem.
"The timing appears a cynical attempt to further avoid public scrutiny as the inquiry was not required to report until late March 2011," Mr Sweeney said.
"There is no reasonable rationale for putting out this report three days before Christmas, especially given that the Federal Court is set to consider this issue in January."
The proposed law would remove appeal rights from the Muckaty people, suspend key indigenous and environmental protection, and override all commonwealth, state and territory laws that could delay or frustrate the opening of a waste dump, Mr Sweeney said.
"It is not based on good science and does not follow a robust, open, transparent process.
"The federal government should stop pushing the contested Muckaty dump plan and establish an independent and public review of nuclear waste management options based on best science, transparent process and community inclusion and consent."

description.hltext_display: Going small to make a point
description.content:
Collison, Ford play at same time
Written by
Filed Under
grizzlies
at pacers
Fox Sports Indianagrizzlies
at pacers
Playing two point guards at the same time was a common occurrence for the Indiana Pacers the past two seasons.
Pacers coach Jim O'Brien often teamed T.J. Ford with Jarrett Jack, or Ford with Earl Watson in the backcourt when he wanted to play "small ball."
O'Brien did it for the first time Monday when he played Ford and Darren Collison together to counter Chris Paul and Jack for New Orleans. It paid off as the Pacers pulled out a last-second, 94-93 victory.
O'Brien made the move because Mike Dunleavy was struggling to defend Jack and Marcus Thornton.
"(Monday) was a day it presented itself," O'Brien said. "(Dunleavy's) not going to guard Jack off pick-and-rolls. Thornton is kind of a real small guy, so we just went with a small lineup. It worked out well for us."
Collison was the point guard and Ford shooting guard in that lineup.
"If teams go small, you can do it and get away with it," Ford said. "At the same time, I think it will be hard to do it consistently when you have guys like Mike and Brandon (Rush) playing so well stretching the floor."
Honoring Coach K
Dunleavy was asked by the Duke sports information department to be part of a video tribute for coach Mike Krzyzewski.
Krzyzewski moved into a second-place tie with former University of North Carolina great Dean Smith on the all-time wins (879) list when the Blue Devils beat Elon on Monday. Former Indiana University coach Bob Knight sits atop the wins list with 902 victories.
"I haven't reached out to (Krzyzewski) yet. I'll probably wait until after he breaks the record before trying to get in touch with him," Dunleavy said. "Depending on what happens this season, he could have the most wins by the end of the season."
Dunleavy won a national championship at Duke in 2001.
All-Star festivities
With a six-day break between games, several Pacers conducted a 3-point shootout and dunk competition after practice Tuesday. They used two racks of balls and had former director of player development Billy Keller work the clock.
Danny Granger won the shootout against rookie Paul George, Dahntay Jones and Roy Hibbert.
Before putting on a personal dunk show, George, a highflier, went with the retro 1980s look and pulled up his shorts to resemble how players of that era such as team president Larry Bird used to look.
George would have scored all "10s" from the judges after he dunked over Hibbert. The dunk was filmed by assistant coach Walter McCarty.
O'Brien said the Pacers are healthy outside of a few minor bruises. Collison (left ankle), who sat out the final two minutes Monday, practiced Tuesday. . . . The Pacers are 8-1 when they make at least 10 3-pointers. They were 11-of-23 against the Hornets.

description.hltext_display: 'Hopey-changey stuff' becomes real
description.author: World's Editorial Writers
description.content: WASHINGTON - President Obama must be tempted to respond to his progressive critics with a quote from the old-school rapper Kool Moe Dee: "How ya like me now?" Repeal of the military's bigoted and anachronistic "don't ask, don't tell" policy on gays in the military - a campaign promise that seemed to be slipping out of reach - doesn't fully mend the relationship between Obama and the Democratic Party's liberal wing. But it's a pretty terrific start. Progressives needed a clear, unambiguous victory to ease the sting of those extended tax cuts for the rich. They got one Saturday with the Senate's historic vote to end "don't ask, don't tell" - and Obama won vindication for the slow, patient, step-by-step approach that drove gay and lesbian activists crazy but ultimately produced a stunning result. Administration officials believed from the beginning that getting the discriminatory policy repealed, and allowing homosexuals to serve openly in the armed forces, would require getting the Pentagon brass on board. The military leadership had to support the change, or at least accept it. Otherwise, repeal-minded members of Congress might balk at casting a vote that could be portrayed as somehow weakening America's defense. So the White House spent months demonstrating that Defense Secretary Robert Gates fully endorsed the end of "don't ask, don't tell" and that the service chiefs would implement the change. A key part of this painstaking strategy was the Pentagon's 10-month study of the impact of eliminating the policy, which concluded, essentially, that there was likely to be no adverse impact at all. The study included a military-wide survey, which found that two-thirds of service members believed ending the policy would have positive, mixed or neutral effects. Perhaps more significant was the study's description of the experience of the British, Canadian and Australian militaries, which changed their rules and allowed gays and lesbians to serve openly. What happened? Nothing at all. "Uniformly, these nations reported that they were aware of no units that had a degradation of cohesion or combat effectiveness, and that the presence of gay men and lesbians in combat units had not been raised as an issue by any of their units deployed in Iraq or Afghanistan," the study reports. None of those other nations had problems with recruiting or retention, either. The change turned out to be a non-issue. Opponents of ending "don't ask, don't tell," including Sen. John McCain, had insisted that Congress not act until the Pentagon study was completed. When it finally came out, they promptly began moving the goalposts, demanding yet more hearings and testimony. It looked as if they were going to run out the clock and leave the issue for the new Congress, which will be far more conservative. But then Joe Lieberman and Susan Collins came to the rescue. I've been sharply critical of Lieberman in the past, and I suspect I'll have occasion to be equally critical in the future. But on "don't ask, don't tell," he was pure gold. Sometimes it seems as if Lieberman, who serves as an independent, delights in driving liberal Democrats crazy, but on social issues he still has a righteous sense of fairness and justice. His well-established record as a hawk on military matters gave him the credibility to push this change - and push it he did, even when all seemed lost. And as for Collins, I've wondered how she can be called a "moderate" when she reliably stands with the archconservative, down-with-the-president GOP leadership in the Senate, especially on important procedural votes. But she was brave and principled on "don't ask," and by linking arms with Lieberman she allowed seven other Republicans to cast their votes on the correct side of history. Now that Congress has acted, the military will move with caution to implement the change. Judging by what has happened in other countries that took this step, however, the process will probably move much faster than anyone expects. A year from now, we'll all be wondering what the big deal was. For gays and lesbians currently serving in the military, this doesn't mean they necessarily have to make public their sexuality. It just means that soon they won't have to fear being discharged for being who they are. And for President Obama and the left, this is an important milestone - a reminder that even in dysfunctional Washington, what Sarah Palin derided as "that hopey-changey stuff" can still produce real hope and change.

description.hltext_display: Former state Dem chairman Powell dies at 90
description.content:
Alamogordo Daily News
ALBUQUERQUE - Former New Mexico Democratic Party chairman Ray Powell Sr. has died at age 90.
Powell was the father of Ray Powell, who was elected state land commissioner last month.
The elder Powell died Thursday in Albuquerque. His son said a ceremony to celebrate the prominent Democrat's life will be held in the next month or so, probably in January.
Powell worked at Sandia National Laboratories for nearly 40 years, retiring from the lab in 1985 as a vice president.
His son said he and his sister got to tour parts of the lab with their father once a year.
"We had no idea what he did, but he seemed to have fun doing it," the younger Powell said.
Powell was chairman of the state Democratic Party from 1988 to 1995.
His only run for public office came in 1986, when he was defeated for governor by Republican Garrey Carruthers.
Under former Gov. Jack Campbell, Powell spearheaded creating a merit system for state employees and headed the state's first personnel board. He also was chairman of the state Mortgage Finance Authority and advisory or review committees on jobs, judicial salaries and highway operations.
"Ray was the consummate public servant, always looking to give back to the community," former Gov. Toney Anaya told the Albuquerque Journal.
Powell also headed a citizens' advisory panel on corrections after a state penitentiary riot in which 33 inmates died at the hands of other inmates.
"I'll never forget him coming home in absolute tears after
walking through the prison that day after the riot," the younger Powell told the Journal.
He said his father was his best friend, and he used to tag along to political events to be with him. The younger Powell was drawn to public service because, he said, his father's work showed him "individual people could make a difference."
Powell is survived by his wife of 61 years, Mary "Penny" Spencer Powell; his son; and his daughter, Pamela Powell.

event_or_fact.property: his father's work showed him "individual people could make a difference.
his father was his best friend, and he used to tag along to political events to be with him
We had no idea what he did, but he seemed to have fun doing it
I'll never forget him coming home in absolute tears after walking through the prison that day after the riot

description.hltext_display: EDITORIAL: 10th and the Bypass jumps out of ground
description.content:
Dec. 22--Anyone who's driven through the 10th Street/Ind. 46 Bypass intersection can't miss them -- large buildings sprouting from the ground.
One is finished and occupied, the Indiana University Innovation Center. Another's floors are poured, ready for enclosure. The innovation center, a little east of the corner, impressed when it stood alone for a few months. Now, though, this new, more massive structure has taken over the landscape. It will be the Cyber Infrastructure Building when finished.
The color rendering on Sunday's front page that describes IU's plans for the intersection and for the widened Ind. 46 Bypass -- also now finally under way -- reveals plans for a lot more to come.
Already there, although with a low profile and in the background, is a key to IU's plan to make this a high-tech corridor that will be attractive to such computer giants as IBM. That's the hulking bunker-like data center, the fire- and tornado-proof structure that protects the university's digital brains, a very secure building that has space for rent.
That and the planned buildings to the west and north should be a strong magnet to companies such as IBM, which chose Dubuque instead of Bloomington for a new 1,300-job data center because Bloomington didn't have ready space.
This push by IU is clear evidence that the university means business when it comes to developing public private partnerships in technology.
That's important. The university is not only an ivory tower, but an absolutely vital economic driver.
To see more of the Herald-Times or to subscribe to the newspaper, go to http://www.heraldtimesonline.com/.

description.hltext_display: Kenton County to vote on smoking ban
description.author: Deborah Haas
description.content:
As Kenton County's Fiscal Court gets ready to vote on whether to ban smoking in public places like restaurants, bars and bowling alleys, business owners are getting concerned.
Chez Nora on Covington's Main Street hosts smokers in the front room. Jimmy Gilliece and his wife Pati have run the business for 17 years. Gilliece said he's sure business will take a hit in the short run if the county passes the smoking ban, but believes customers will come back.
"I'm counting on that," he said. Gilliece worries, though, about smaller businesses. In his opinion, "bowling alleys, VFW halls, I think they are going to see much more negative fallout from this than say Chez Nora."
Down the road at the Anchor Grill on Pike Street, the manager worries that after 64 years in business, they might close if the ban passes.
Jump to full article

event_or_fact.property: he's sure business will take a hit in the short run if the county passes the smoking ban, but believes customers will come back

description.hltext_display: Schools: Algonquin cruises in the pool
description.author: Staff reports
description.content:
Junior Mike Ficenec won the 200 individual medley and the 500 freestyle and Algonquin routed Worcester 99-39 in a non-league coed swimming meet.
Sophomore Carl Lindgren was also a double-winner, taking first in the 500 free and 100 breaststroke for the Tomahawks (3-1). Claudia Capria (100 butterfly), senior co-captain Ellie Temte (200 free) and Mark Kerstens (100 free) also won events for Algonquin.
KING PHILIP 111, HOPKINTON 72: Junior John Lagasse won the 100 breaststroke in 105.06, but Hopkinton fell to King Philip (3-0) in a non-league meet.
Junior Juliana Tordella also had a win for Hopkinton in diving (156.20). The Hillers fell to 2-1.
BOYS SWIMMING
NEWTON NORTH 97, NATICK 88: Tony Li was a double winner for Natick (100 butterfly, 500 freestyle) but it wasn't enough as they lost to host Newton North.
The Red and Blue (1-1, 0-1 BSC) also got winning performances from Jeff Thibault (diving), Duncan Freedman (100 backstroke) and Doug Dube (100 breaststroke).
Li, Freedman, Dube and Vinnie Palanukorn won the medley relay for Natick.
GYMNASTICS
NATICK 127.8, WALPOLE 120.2: Savannah Keller took first on the bars, second on the beam and third on the floor as Natick edged Walpole in Bay State Conference action.
Simon Casey placed first in the vault while Jenna Corkey won the floor (8.6) and had a pair of third-place finishes in the vault and beam for the Red and Blue (1-1).
Claire Gerdes had a second-place finish in the floor exercise for Natick.
WRESTLING
NATICK 68, WELLESLEY 6: Tim Arthur won by pin at 160 pounds for Natick as the visiting Red and Blue routed Wellesley in a Bay State Conference meet.
Peter Gutierrez won by pin at 119 pounds and Glen Duffy also won by pin at 171 in a dominating performance by Natick. Christian Hernandez added a victory by decision at 152 pounds for the Red and Blue.
TRACK
MARIAN 110, ST. MARY'S 20: Marian's Billy Kinsherf qualified for states by winning the shot put with a throw of 40 feet, 10 inches as the Mustangs raced past St. Mary's of Lynn in a Catholic Central League coed track meet at the Reggie Lewis Center.
Maria Schwab won the 600 meters in 1:48 for Marian (2-0).
BOYS HOCKEY
HOLLISTON 8, EAST BOSTON 0: Connor Dupont had a two goals and an assist and Brody Mankus also tallied twice as Holliston cruised past visiting East Boston in a non-league matchup.
Eric Witunski had a goal and two assists, Max Turcotte and John Georgallas added goals, and sophomore Ed Weiner netted his first career varsity goal for Holliston (1-0-1), which led 1-0 after the first period and broke it open with five second-period goals.

description.hltext_display: 海口"迷糊哥"驾车撞死人 逃逸途中再肇事伤人[图]
description.content:
肇事逃逸又撞一人 行人自发保护现场
热心市民自发保护车祸现场
20日晚10时许，海口金盘路发生一起车祸，一辆白色小汽车撞死一名行人后逃逸，随后又撞上一名骑电动车的男子并拖行20多米。令人感动的是，在交警到来前，周围热心群众自发保护车祸现场，并设法联系到死者的亲属。
广西民工死于非命
20日晚10点20分左右，记者赶到金盘路与建设二横路交叉口看到，一名中年男子倒在路上，120急救人员已经赶到，将男子抬上救护车疾驰而去。
记者注意到，现场已经被人用砖头和树枝围了起来。一位市民告诉记者，为了完整地保护现场，大家自发从附近找来砖头和树枝围住这里，还有人主动指挥交通，不断给过往车辆打手势绕行，避免事故现场遭到破坏。一名男子正拿着被撞者的手机不断拨打电话，试图联系其家人。由于手机中的电话号码很多，而且时间很晚，不少电话都拨不通，但热心男子仍然一个接一个地拨打，直到联系到被撞男子的家属后，赶紧将情况告知对方。
“肇事车是辆白色小车，车牌号我都记下了!”距离事发地点最近的目击者杨先生告诉记者，大约在10点10分左右，他驾车经过建设二横路路口处，看到一名行人过马路，一辆白色小汽车与行人相擦，随后该行人倒在地上。
“当时没看到是怎么撞的，但看到有人倒在地上，我就马上停车。”杨先生看到白色小车在十几米外的地方停了大约10秒钟左右，又马上开走了，司机也没有下车查看。杨先生记下车牌号是琼AC94xx，随后叫旁边的人拨打110报警，并和大家一同组织保护现场。
当警方来到现场时，记者得知，被撞男子已被宣告死亡。死者姓赵，广西人，和哥哥一起在万宁打工，这几天是特地请假来海口和朋友玩，有一8岁的女儿在广西上学，妻子在家里照顾女儿。
肇事车再撞伤一人
而在撞倒这名行人后，白色小车从金盘路左拐至坡巷路后，又撞倒了一名骑电动车的男子。“要不是电动车替我挡住了车轮，我现在恐怕也死了。”第二位被撞的市民蔡先生回忆起当时，仍然心有余悸。他的胳膊、腿上多处被擦伤。
蔡先生记下的车牌号与杨先生的车牌号一样。他说，他从车后镜中看到，后面有一辆白色小车朝他开过来，他马上靠边行驶想要避让，没想到白色小车一头撞了过来，他和电动车被卡在车前，并被往前推了20多米，才被甩了出去。他马上从地上爬起来想喊住司机，可小车开得更快了，他只好记下了车牌号并报警。
据海口市事故处理大队重案中队的交警介绍，警方查到肇事车辆的单位及司机，联系到司机家属后却被告知不在家。
21日上午，肇事司机龚某向警方自首。龚某籍贯重庆，46岁，从事销售行业，肇事车辆是他向朋友借用的。龚某表示愿意对自己的行为负责，待死者妻子从广西来海口后，再处理赔偿等问题。
目前龚某已被刑事拘留。警方已对其进行抽血检验是否属于酒后驾驶。
记者采访龚某时，他表示事发时不知道自己撞了人，在酒店里睡了一晚，手机也没有开。第二天早上直到家里人给他打电话，才知道撞了人。他表示已经在筹钱，等死者家属来后再具体商量如何处理。得知一名伤者已经身亡后，龚某闭上双眼说：“我对不起他们，我很后悔，很惭愧。”(记者史晓晖摄影报道)

description.hltext_display: Why?
description.content:
Mississippi State sophomore Renardo Sidney?s long-awaited return to the basketball court has hit a snag.
The 6-foot-10 forward has been suspended for one game for ?conduct detrimental to the team,? school spokesman Gregg Ellis said Tuesday. Ellis confirmed that the suspension is related to an incident during Monday?s practice, but he declined to provide further details.
The school released a statement on Tuesday afternoon saying Sidney was suspended indefinitely, but sent another release less than an hour later changing the punishment to a one-game suspension. Ellis said the problem was a miscommunication, and that Stansbury had not changed his decision. ?Sid is suspended for conduct detrimental to the team,? MSU coach Rick Stansbury said in the second statement. ?That?s all I?m saying. That?s all that needs to be said.? Sidney has played in only one game this season because of an NCAA suspension. He scored 12 points and grabbed three rebounds in 25 minutes before fouling out in the Bulldogs? 88-57 loss to Virginia Tech on Saturday.
Mississippi State is currently in Hawaii for the Diamond Head Classic tournament and plays Washington State on Wednesday. Sidney will remain with the team.
An elite recruit from the 2009 class, Sidney grew up in Jackson, Miss., but played at a Los Angeles high school. The NCAA ruled in March that he received preferential treatment and improper benefits because of his ability, and that he also violated ethics rules by providing false or misleading statements.
Sidney was forced to repay $11,800 in improper benefits and sit out the remainder of the 2010 season, along with the first nine games this season.
Along with his eligibility issues, Sidney has also battled a bulging waistline. At about 275 pounds, he acknowledged last week that he?s at least 10 pounds overweight despite practicing with the team all season.
During an exhibition game last week, which was specifically scheduled to help Sidney get into game shape, he battled leg cramps throughout the second half. It?s been a chaotic year for Mississippi State (7-3), which is also without point guard Dee Bost, the team?s leading scorer last season.
Bost was ruled academically ineligible for the fall semester and now is serving a nine-game NCAA suspension after failing to pull out of the NBA draft by the deadline last spring. He is eligible to return Jan. 8 for the team?s SEC opener against Alabama.

event_or_fact.property: the problem was a miscommunication, and that Stansbury had not changed his decision
the suspension is related to an incident during Monday?s practice, but he declined to provide further details.
he?s at least 10 pounds overweight despite practicing with the team all season.

description.hltext_display: Suposto taxista atua em assalto a posto
description.content:
Homem que dirigia táxi abasteceu carro e foi conversar com motoqueiros, que minutos depois anunciaram roubo
| LÁZARO CALHEIROS * - Estagiário
Um taxista não identificado e dirigindo um carro Siena da empresa Pontual Táxi participou de um assalto, ontem à tarde, ao posto de combustíveis Catolé, próximo à sede do Batalhão de Polícia Ambiental, no bairro Clima Bom. O posto foi assaltado por dois motoqueiros armados, que foram ajudados pelo taxista. Os motoqueiros roubaram R$ 2 mil e ainda chegaram a atirar contra os clientes e funcionários antes de fugir.
“O taxista parou no posto para reabastecer R$ 5 de combustível e depois foi até a esquina da rua, conversar com os dois motoqueiros. Após alguns minutos, os motoqueiros renderam os frentistas e ainda dispararam quando os funcionários e clientes tentaram anotar a placa da moto”, explicou o policial militar do 8º Batalhão, capitão Antão.
Os policiais ainda fizeram rondas pelo bairro, na tentativa de localizar os assaltantes, mas ninguém foi encontrado.
* Sob supervisão da editoria de Cidades
Leia mais na versão impressa

description.hltext_display: Nearly 1 in 4 Fails U.S. Military Exam
description.author: foxnewsonline@foxnews.com
description.content:
MIAMI – Nearly one-fourth of the students who try to join the U.S. Army fail its entrance exam, painting a grim picture of an education system that produces graduates who can't answer basic math, science and reading questions, according to a new study released Tuesday.
The report by The Education Trust bolsters a growing worry among military and education leaders that the pool of young people qualified for military service will grow too small.
"Too many of our high school students are not graduating ready to begin college or a career — and many are not eligible to serve in our armed forces," U.S. Education Secretary Arne Duncan told the AP. "I am deeply troubled by the national security burden created by America's underperforming education system."
The effect of the low eligibility rate might not be noticeable now — the Department of Defense says it is meeting its recruitment goals — but that could change as the economy improves, said retired Navy Rear Admiral Jamie Barnett.
"If you can't get the people that you need, there's a potential for a decline in your readiness," said Barnett, who is part of the group Mission: Readiness, a coalition of retired military leaders working to bring awareness to the high ineligibility rates.
The report by The Education Trust found that 23 percent of recent high school graduates don't get the minimum score needed on the enlistment test to join any branch of the military. Questions are often basic, such as: "If 2 plus x equals 4, what is the value of x?"
The military exam results are also worrisome because the test is given to a limited pool of people: Pentagon data shows that 75 percent of those aged 17 to 24 don't even qualify to take the test because they are physically unfit, have a criminal record or didn't graduate high school.
Educators expressed dismay that so many high school graduates are unable to pass a test of basic skills.
"It's surprising and shocking that we are still having students who are walking across the stage who really don't deserve to be and haven't earned that right," said Tim Callahan with the Professional Association of Georgia Educators, a group that represents more than 80,000 educators.
Kenneth Jackson, 19, of Miami, enlisted in the Army after graduating from high school. He said passing the entrance exam is easy for those who paid attention in school, but blamed the education system for why more recruits aren't able to pass the test.
"The classes need to be tougher because people aren't learning enough," Jackson said.
This is the first time that the U.S. Army has released this test data publicly, said Amy Wilkins of The Education Trust, a Washington, D.C.-based children's advocacy group. The study examined the scores of nearly 350,000 high school graduates, ages 17 to 20, who took the ASVAB exam between 2004 and 2009. About half of the applicants went on to join the Army.
Recruits must score at least a 31 out of 99 on the first stage of the three-hour test to get into the Army. The Marines, Air Force, Navy and Coast Guard recruits need higher scores.
Further tests determine what kind of job the recruit can do with questions on mechanical maintenance, accounting, word comprehension, mathematics and science.
The study shows wide disparities in scores among white and minority students, similar to racial gaps on other standardized tests. Nearly 40 percent of black students and 30 percent of Hispanics don't pass, compared with 16 percent of whites. The average score for blacks is 38 and for Hispanics is 44, compared to whites' average score of 55.
Even those passing muster on the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery, or ASVAB, usually aren't getting scores high enough to snag the best jobs.
"A lot of times, schools have failed to step up and challenge these young people, thinking it didn't really matter — they'll straighten up when they get into the military," said Kati Haycock, president of the Education Trust. "The military doesn't think that way."
Entrance exams for the U.S. military date to World War I. The test has changed over time as computers and technology became more prevalent, and skills like ability to translate Morse code have fallen by the wayside.
The test was overhauled in 2004, and the study only covers scores from 2004 through 2009. The Education Trust didn't request examine earlier data to avoid a comparison between two versions of the test, said Christina Theokas, the author of the study. The Army did not immediately respond to requests for further information.
Tom Loveless, an education expert at the Brookings Institution think tank, said the results echo those on other tests. In 2009, 26 percent of seniors performed below the 'basic' reading level on the National Assessment of Education Progress.
Other tests, like the SAT, look at students who are going to college.
"A lot of people make the charge that in this era of accountability and standardized testing, that we've put too much emphasis on basic skills," Loveless said. "This study really refutes that. We have a lot of kids that graduate from high school who have not mastered basic skills."
The study also found disparities across states, with Wyoming having the lowest ineligibility rate, at 13 percent, and Hawaii having the highest, at 38.3 percent.
Retired military leaders say the report's findings are cause for concern.
"The military is a lot more high-tech than in the past," said retired Air Force Lt. Gen. Norman R. Seip. "I don't care if you're a soldier Marine carrying a backpack or someone sitting in a research laboratory, the things we expect out of our military members requires a very, very well educated force."
A Department of Defense report notes the military must recruit about 15 percent of youth, but only one-third are eligible. More high school graduates are going to college than in earlier decades, and about one-fourth are obese, making them medically ineligible.
In 1980, by comparison, just 5 percent of youth were obese.

event_or_fact.property: The military is a lot more high-tech than in the past; I don't care if you're a soldier Marine carrying a backpack or someone sitting in a research laboratory, the things we expect out of our military members requires a very, very well educated force.
passing the entrance exam is easy for those who paid attention in school, but blamed the education system for why more recruits aren't able to pass the test
The effect of the low eligibility rate might not be noticeable now ? the Department of Defense says it is meeting its recruitment goals ? but that could change as the economy improves
The classes need to be tougher because people aren't learning enough
The Education Trust didn't request examine earlier data to avoid a comparison between two versions of the test

A lot of times, schools have failed to step up and challenge these young people, thinking it didn't really matter ? they'll straighten up when they get into the military; The military doesn't think that way.
If you can't get the people that you need, there's a potential for a decline in your readiness

A lot of people make the charge that in this era of accountability and standardized testing, that we've put too much emphasis on basic skills; This study really refutes that. We have a lot of kids that graduate from high school who have not mastered basic
It's surprising and shocking that we are still having students who are walking across the stage who really don't deserve to be and haven't earned that right

Too many of our high school students are not graduating ready to begin college or a career ? and many are not eligible to serve in our armed forces; I am deeply troubled by the national security burden created by America's underperforming education system
This is the first time that the U.S. Army has released this test data publicly

description.hltext_display: Fiscais da SMCCU destroem guarita
description.content:
Para Assis, que conduzia o procedimento naquele loteamento, não houve erro algum, mas sim “um simples” acidente de trabalho
| MAIKEL MARQUES - Repórter
A guarita que garantia “segurança” ao loteamento Eldorado e justificava o pagamento de R$ 45,00 mensais da maioria dos 600 moradores à milícia que diz combater a malandragem no bairro do Feitosa, foi destruída ontem cedo por determinação da Procuradoria Geral do Município. Outras 62 serão removidas em diversos bairros da capital porque foram edificadas sem amparo legal, ferindo o princípio constitucional do ir e vir.
“Essas diversas guaritas representam a invasão e usurpação postas em prática por muitas associações de moradores que foram criadas em loteamentos com a finalidade de contrariar a Constituição e proibir o acesso ao espaço público”, esclarece o engenheiro Galvacy de Assis, responsável pela fiscalização da Secretaria Municipal do Controle do Convívio Urbano (SMCCU).
Ontem cedo, seus subordinados cumpriram determinação da Procuradoria do Município e puseram abaixo a cabine com teto de concreto armado construída na entrada do loteamento Eldorado, no Feitosa. Durante a operação, a pequena construção tombou na direção do muro da residência da funcionária pública Julieta de Medeiros. “Acordei com o barulho da destruição”, conta o estudante Luís Augusto, filho da dona do imóvel.
Leia mais na versão impressa
Derrubada da guarita de segurança de loteamento acabou atingindo muro de uma residência. Foto: Ricardo Lêdo

description.hltext_display: Lula sinaliza que vetará corte no PAC
description.content:
Serys Slhessarenko propôs o bloqueio de R$ 3,35 bilhões dos R$ 43,5 bilhões destinados ao programa
| FOLHAPRESS
Serys Slhessarenko propôs o bloqueio de R$ 3,35 bilhões dos R$ 43,5 bilhões destinados ao programa
Rio de Janeiro, RJ – O presidente Lula sinalizou ontem que vai vetar eventual corte no orçamento do Programa de Aceleração do Crescimento (PAC). Ele disse que a atuação da relatora da matéria, Serys Slhessarenko (PT-MT), é limitada. “Eu tenho poder de veto. Esse orçamento que for votado vai vir para mim. O fato da relatora dizer que vai fazer isso ou aquilo... Primeiro é preciso saber se vai fazer”, disse ele.
Slhessarenko propôs o bloqueio de R$ 3,35 bilhões dos R$ 43,5 bilhões destinados ao programa. Segundo o presidente, não haverá redução porque “o compromisso da companheira Dilma Rousseff é o desenvolvimento desse País”.
Lula participou de testes do teleférico do Complexo do Alemão, no Rio – parte da obra do PAC na região. Do local, participou por videoconferência da inauguração da ampliação da rua 4, na Rocinha e da duplicação de trecho da BR-101 entre Santa Cruz (zona oeste do Rio) e Mangaratiba.
Dilma anuncia mais cinco nomes para o alto escalão
ANDREA JUBÉ VIANNA - Agência Estado
Brasília, DF – A presidente eleita, Dilma Rousseff, divulgou ontem à noite os nomes de mais cinco ministros que integrarão sua equipe de governo. Fora do ministério, o deputado Ciro Gomes emplacou um conterrâneo, o prefeito de Sobral (CE), Leônidas Cristino, na Secretaria de Portos.
Ex-deputado federal, Cristino sempre pertenceu à base de apoio de Ciro Gomes, quando este foi prefeito de Fortaleza e governador do Ceará. Embora Dilma tenha cogitado inflar a pasta, acrescentando às suas funções o controle dos aeroportos, a nota oficial divulgada pela assessoria do governo de transição aponta Cristino, apenas, como ministro de Portos. Dilma também confirmou o secretário de Desenvolvimento Econômico de Pernambuco, Fernando Bezerra Coelho, no Ministério da Integração Nacional. Ex-prefeito de Petrolina, Coelho ingressa na equipe de Dilma como um nome da cota pessoal do governador de Pernambuco e presidente do PSB, Eduardo Campos.
Prefeitos se mobilizam contra veto
| DAVI SOARES - Repórter
Prefeituras dos 102 municípios de Alagoas e do restante do País dedicaram o dia de ontem à mobilização contra a disposição do presidente Lula em vetar a chamada Emenda Simon, que prevê a distribuição dos valores dos royalties do petróleo do pré-sal de forma igualitária para todos os Estados brasileiros.
Enquanto milhares de municípios se mobilizaram por meio de faixas, entrevistas em rádios, paralisações parciais de serviços e envio de e-mails e telegramas para a Presidência da República, Lula reafirmou ontem, em visita ao Complexo do Alemão, seu compromisso com os Estados do Rio de Janeiro, Espírito Santo e São Paulo – produtores de petróleo que continuarão ganhando mais royalties obtidos com a exploração petrolífera, em comparação com os demais estados.
Acelino Popó planeja bancada com Romário e Danrlei
| MATHEUS MAGENTA - Folhapress
Salvador, BA – Dos ringues para o Congresso Nacional. O boxeador Acelino Popó Freitas (PRB-BA), 35, conquistou um vaga na Câmara dos Deputados com a saída do deputado federal Mário Negromonte (PP-BA), que comandará o Ministério das Cidades.Popó já tem seu primeiro plano: formar uma bancada do esporte com os deputados eleitos Romário (PSB-RJ) e Danrlei (PTB-RS). Secretário municipal de Esportes de Salvador entre 2007 e 2008, Popó disse que deixou cargo porque não conseguia executar o orçamento da pasta.
Neste ano, o ex-boxeador obteve 60.338 votos e se tornou o primeiro suplente na coligação aliada do governador reeleito da Bahia, Jaques Wagner (PT). Para Popó, o problema do esporte brasileiro não é a falta de recursos, mas de projetos, como a sua proposta de ajuda a ex-atletas que “hoje estão desamparados”.
Leia mais na versão impressa

description.hltext_display: Road rage doctor could lose sports car
description.content:
A Perth doctor convicted of road rage will soon learn whether his Alfa Romeo sports car will be permanently confiscated when a magistrate hands down his landmark verdict.
Police want to seize the car belonging to Ala'A Mohammed Ali Al Rammahi who earlier this year pleaded guilty to reckless driving and was fined.
Angry a woman had beeped her horn at him, Al Rammahi followed and repeatedly pulled in front of her car, traumatising her and her children.
Police are using a 2007 amendment to anti-hoon confiscation legislation that allows for vehicles to be seized for road rage offences.
Al Rammahi, who owns two medical practices, is fighting the application, claiming he would suffer severe financial hardship if he lost his car, valued at between $17,000 and $20,000.
In the Perth Magistrates Court on Wednesday, Al Rammahi's lawyer Max Crispe questioned the validity of the application.
He argued police technically erred by failing to give his client notice and issued the application without authority.
Prosecutor Mike Crook said the application should not be dismissed because it was made "in the spirit" of the legislation.
Magistrate Guiseppe Cicchini said the case could be the first of its kind and queries over errors with the application had to be resolved.
The court heard that the doctor had financial problems, including a defaulted loan on a multi-million dollar home. He also still owes about $6000 on his car.
Mr Crook asked Al Rammahi how he expected to make repayments on his car because he had failed to make the past two.
"I have not paid but (that) doesn't mean that I can't pay," he said.
When pressed further, Al Rammahi snapped: "Do you think I'm lying for $17,000?"
In his closing submissions, Mr Crispe said his client unlikely to re-offend.
Magistrate Cicchini said he would have to consider the doctor's financial and physical hardship, and other relevant factors including the seriousness of the offence, before making his decision on Thursday.

event_or_fact.property: I have not paid but (that) doesn't mean that I can't pay
he would have to consider the doctor's financial and physical hardship, and other relevant factors including the seriousness of the offence, before making his decision on Thursday
police technically erred by failing to give his client notice and issued the application without authority
the case could be the first of its kind and queries over errors with the application had to be resolved
the application should not be dismissed because it was made "in the spirit" of the legislation

description.hltext_display: Aeroviários mantêm greve para amanhã
description.content:
Paralisação pode provocar ainda mais confusão nos aeroportos neste fim de ano; trabalhadores rejeitaram contraproposta
| SOFIA FERNANDES - Folhapress
Paralisação pode provocar ainda mais confusão nos aeroportos neste fim de ano; trabalhadores rejeitaram contraproposta
| SOFIA FERNANDES - Folhapress
Brasília, DF – Após reunião sem consenso entre trabalhadores e empresas de aviação, ontem, no Ministério Público do Trabalho, está mantida para amanhã a greve do setor, que pode provocar ainda mais confusão nos aeroportos.
Os trabalhadores aeroviários (que fazem as operações em solo) exigem reajuste salarial de 13%, e os aeronautas (tripulação de voo), de 15%. As empresas elevaram ontem sua proposta de reajuste de 6,08% para 6,58%. Os trabalhadores recusaram.
O procurador-geral do Trabalho, Otavio Brito Lopes, afirmou que as negociações continuam e que há tempo ainda para evitar a greve. O consenso, porém, parece distante, nas propostas de reajuste e no sentimento de que a greve vai acontecer. O sindicato das empresas saiu da reunião confiante de que os trabalhadores não estão articulados o bastante.
Leia mais na versão impressa

description.hltext_display: “พลอย” ถูกใจฉายา “นางฟ้ามาเฟีย” บอกเป็นคาแรคเตอร์ตัวเอง ที่ไม่ยอมให้ใครมารังแก ดีกว่าปีท
Importação deve ter maior alta desde 95
description.content:
Maiores compras no ano, até a 3ª semana de dezembro, foram de combustíveis, carros e medicamentos
| SOFIA FERNANDES - Folhapress
Brasília, DF – Com dólar desvalorizado e economia em crescimento, o ano deve chegar ao fim com a maior alta nas importações desde 1995 – a maior do governo Lula –, segundo previsão do Ministério do Desenvolvimento.
O secretário de Comércio Exterior do Ministério do Desenvolvimento, Welber Barral, estima que 2010 terá um incremento de 43,9% nas importações, ante crescimento de 30,7% nas exportações.
Até a terceira semana de dezembro, o país importou US$ 175,89 bilhões, alta de US$ 51,97 bilhões na comparação com igual período de 2009 e US$ 48 bilhões a mais que todo o ano passado.
Leia mais na versão impressa

description.hltext_display: Brasileiros denunciam Air France
description.content:
Paris, França – Não foram nem a neve, nem o frio que irritaram os brasileiros que ficaram bloqueados nos principais aeroportos franceses desde o último sábado. Depois de quatro dias caóticos, com milhares de voos cancelados ou adiados, os brasileiros que tentavam embarcar ontem no Aeroporto Roissy-Charles-de-Gaulle eram unânimes em denunciar o “desprezo” das companhias aéreas, entre elas da Air France e da TAM.
Carina e Christian Pietrobelli tentavam, há 48 horas, chegar a Londres (Reino Unido), onde deveriam passar a lua de mel. Eles embarcaram no Rio no último domingo e deveriam fazer escala em Paris na segunda, às 8h, horário local. Porém, alguns minutos antes de aterrissar, foram avisados de que o avião deveria ser redirecionado para outro aeroporto. “Quando, finalmente, chegamos a Paris, às 13h, tivemos que adivinhar o que fazer”. Segundo os brasileiros, as informações dadas pelos atendentes da Air France eram desencontradas e pouco precisas.
Leia mais na versão impressa
Roissy-Charles-de-Gaulle: 40% dos voos foram cancelados. Foto:

description.hltext_display: Yves Bozon, Directeur des Investissements chez Pictet & Cie
description.content: Boursier.com : Quelle est votre vision de l'économie mondiale pour l'année prochaine ? Y.B. : Nous tablons sur une croissance positive mais avec un fort contraste entre les économies développées et les économies émergentes. Au sein des économies en développement, on devrait également avoir une divergence entre les pays qui ont une devise flottante et ceux qui ont une devise liée au Dollar. Nous pensons que la croissance des USA en 2011 devrait être de 3,25%. En Europe, la croissance devrait être moindre, seule l'Allemagne devrait tirer son épingle du jeu. Dans les marchés émergents, on s'attend à 5% de croissance en moyenne mais le contrôle des pressions inflationnistes sera important. Boursier.com : Quid de la différence de politique et de stratégie entre la BCE et la FED ? Y.B. : Nous considérons la situation de l'Amérique fondamentalement différente de celle de l'Allemagne. Il y a donc un dialogue de sourds entre allemands et américains sur le remède et la réponse à apporter en terme de policy-mix. Outre-Atlantique, bien que le crédit soit quasiment offert à taux zéro, il n'y a toujours pas de demande, les ménages sont encore surendettés. Dans cette situation, nous pensons que la politique menée par la Fed va dans la bonne direction. L'accord sur le budget 2011 est également une bonne chose dans la mesure ou tant que le secteur privé est en phase de désendettement, il est tout à fait illusoire de vouloir contrôler le déficit budgétaire. En Europe, la situation est beaucoup plus complexe avec des pays qui souffrent de surendettement et d'autres où le secteur privé est sain. La BCE a donc fondamentalement une mission quasi impossible à accomplir puisque elle a deux situations opposées à régler. Boursier.com : Comment voyez-vous évoluer la parité euro/dollar ? Y.B. : Compte tenu des difficultés auxquelles fait face l'UE, les risques sont plutôt du côté de la monnaie unique. Le Dollar est donc plutôt haussier, d'autant qu'il est toujours une valeur refuge. Néanmoins les problèmes sont également importants aux Etats-Unis, et on n'est pas à l'abri de brusques changements de tendance. La parité devrait donc être assez chaotique l'an prochain, avec au final un biais légèrement haussier pour le billet vert. Boursier.com : Au niveau des marchés actions, beaucoup de spécialistes sont assez optimistes pour 2011, est-ce également votre cas ? Y.B. : Tout à fait. Les actions des pays développés se négocient avec une décote par rapport aux valeurs des pays émergents. On y trouve également davantage de sociétés de qualité. De plus, ces marchés occidentaux ont été ignorés ces dernières années par les investisseurs au détriment justement des marchés émergents qui ont reçu des flux importants. Boursier.com : Y-a-t-il des secteurs à privilégier sur ces marchés développés ? Y.B. : On doit s'efforcer de favoriser les sociétés qui bénéficient du commerce mondial. En revanche, il convient d'éviter les valeurs exposées aux budgets des états développés qui sont dans une phase d'ajustement. On doit ainsi demeurer à l'écart des secteurs de l'électricité et des télécoms. Nous évitons aussi les valeurs financières, les nouvelles régulations vont en effet diminuer le rendement des fonds propres.

description.hltext_display: Signing won't end 'don't ask' right away
description.content:
A bill being signed into law by President Obama to end the U.S. military's "don't ask, don't tell policy" will not alter the policy immediately, officials said.
The president, along with Defense Secretary Robert Gates and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Adm. Mike Mullen, must first certify to Congress in writing the U.S. armed forces have drafted necessary new policies and regulations and are ready to operate with openly gay, lesbian or bisexual men and women in military service. The certification must also affirm the changes will not hurt troop readiness, cohesion or military recruitment and retention, the new law states.
Once the written notice is submitted, there will be a 60-day waiting period before "don't ask, don't tell" is officially repealed.
U.S. Defense Department spokesman Geoff Morrell said he couldn't predict how long the administration would need to get everything in order, saying only the rules and regulations would be worked out at a "methodical" and "deliberate" pace. White House Press Secretary Robert Gibbs said he didn't expect the process would be "overly burdensome."
Gay rights leaders believe the military could end full enforcement in a matter of weeks, The Washington Post reported. Obama is to sign the bill at 9:15 a.m. EST Wednesday, ending a 17-year ban on gays serving openly in uniform.
A last-ditch effort by Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., to block the change was blocked late Tuesday night by Sen. Joe Lieberman, I-Conn., Senate aides told Politico.
McConnell had tried to derail the change by adding an amendment to a defense-spending bill that would have required the four military-service chiefs to be part of the Obama-Gates-Mullen certification process.
That would have given U.S. Marine Corps Commandant Gen. James Amos, a vocal opponent of the repeal, power to delay or possibly prevent its implementation, The New York Times reported.

event_or_fact.property: he couldn't predict how long the administration would need to get everything in order, saying only the rules and regulations would be worked out at a "methodical" and "deliberate" pace
he didn't expect the process would be "overly burdensome.

description.hltext_display: Cina, stop alle parole inglesi su stampa e pubblicazioni
description.content: Secondo l'organo preposto al controllo della stampa, l'uso della lingua inglese misto a quella cinese danneggia gravemente la purezza della cultura - L'Amministrazione generale per la stampa e le pubblicazioni (Gapp), censura la consuetudine dei giornali cinesi che usano "le parole straniere mischiate con quelle cinesi danneggiando gravemente la purezza della lingua cinese e turbando l'altrimenti sano e armonioso ambiente culturale". L'uso di alcune parole come cool o di abbreviazioni inglesi come Cpi (indice dei prezzi al consumo, la misura dell'inflazione) o Gdp (Prodotto interno lordo) sono frequenti nella lingua parlata cinese e sono largamente usati anche dalla stampa e nei libri, in particolare in quelli di economia.

description.hltext_display: No letdown: Boilers coast into break
description.content:
WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind. -- When JaJuan Johnson was a Purdue freshman, the Boilermakers lost to Wofford in their final home game before Christmas break.
The 6-10 senior center made sure there would be no repeat Tuesday night, contributing 24 points and 13 rebounds in 14th-ranked Purdue's 77-52 victory against IPFW in Mackey Arena.
"We did a real good job defensively," Johnson said. "That was one of the things we really tried to concentrate on.
"You definitely don't want any letdowns going into Christmas break. I still remember when we lost to Wofford. That will forever stick with me. It was a good lesson to learn. You definitely didn't want that to happen again."
After IPFW (7-4) raced to a 7-2 lead, the Boilermakers countered with an 18-4 run, grabbing a 20-11 advantage with 8:04 to play in the opening half.
The Mastodons got to within 31-24 with the second half's first basket, but Purdue countered with a 13-0 run that sealed its victory. A Johnson basket capped that burst and gave the Boilermakers a 44-24 lead with 16:02 remaining.
With sophomore guard/forward D.J. Byrd adding 15 points on five 3-pointers, and E'Twaun Moore finishing with 11 points, five rebounds, six assists and five steals, the Boilermakers had plenty of support for Johnson in their final game before beginning Big Ten Conference action Dec. 28 at Michigan.
Purdue, which won its sixth straight game, shot 53.4 percent from the field (31-of-58), going 10-of-22 from 3-point range.
"When we had success in this game, it was because we were patient and guys were taking shots in rhythm," Purdue coach Matt Painter said. "We got the ball inside to E'Twaun, and we got the ball inside to JaJuan.
"It's important for us to get that inside, outside. We stepped up and made shots. When we keep the game simple, we're pretty efficient and pretty productive."
Junior point guard Lewis Jackson had another solid game with eight points, eight assists and no turnovers. Seven of Jackson's assists came in the second half, when the Boilermakers outscored IPFW 46-30.
"I just pushed the basketball," Jackson said. "By making that 3-pointer in the first half, it made coach realize I can still shoot it. That gave us an advantage, but we also got steals. Guys got to leak out, and JaJuan did a great job posting up."
Painter liked the Boilers' second-half start, hitting their first six shots. They made 17-of-26 shots over the final 20 minutes.
"One of the most important segments of the game is the first five minutes of the second half," Painter said. ". . . Obviously, if your defense can create some offense, it definitely is going to help you. When we played in the half court, our guys made some pretty good decisions."
For IPFW coach Dane Fife there were not enough weapons to counteract the Boilers' mix of inside and outside offense. Purdue held the Mastodons to 34.6 percent from the field.
"We missed some shots that we definitely needed to make to stay in the game with Purdue," said Fife, the former Indiana guard. "With their pressure, size and strength, it's just something that we're not built to handle at this point."
Purdue freshman guard Terone Johnson took a nasty fall with 11:47 remaining, landing on his right shoulder. He returned and hit a 3-pointer with 2:07 left, finishing with eight points.
Reserve forward Oleg Kovalov led IPFW with 12 points, hitting 4-of-4 from 3-point range.

event_or_fact.property: When we had success in this game, it wasbecause we were patient and guys were taking shots in rhythm
We did a real good job defensively

I just pushed the basketball; By making that 3-pointer in the first half, it made coach realize I can still shoot it. That gave us an advantage, but we also got steals. Guys got to leak out, and JaJuan did a great job posting up.
We missed some shots that we definitely needed to make to stay in the game with Purdue; With their pressure, size and strength, it's just something that we're not built to handle at this point.

description.hltext_display: 科技局长违规用公款 临高揪出违法违纪干部开除7人
description.content:
科技局长违规使用公款 镇委书记非法占有公款
临高今年揪出一批违法违纪干部
临高县科技局原局长违规使用公款，东英镇委原书记非法占有公款，双双被查处。这是记者今日从临高县纪检监察机关获悉的。今年以来临高查获一系列违法违纪案件，给予党政纪处分37人。
据了解，今年以来临高县纪检监察机关共查结案件12件，给予党政纪处分37人。其中科级干部7人，移送司法机关查处3人，开除党籍7人，开除公职7人。
影响较大的案件主要有：临高县科技局原局长违反财经纪律私设“小金库”，违规使用公款，受到开除党籍和行政撤职处分;东英镇原镇委书记任职期间非法占有公款，受到留党察看2年处分;对15名党员干部工作失职，致使一护士和一小学教师超生的问题进行责任追究，临高县人民医院原院长、分管副院长分别受到党内严重警告和行政记大过处分，并分别受到组织处理。
另外，在今年10月强降雨期间，临高县皇桐镇和仙水库溃坝，造成了恶劣的社会影响，临高县纪检监察机关对该事件中工作失职的10名镇干部进行责任追究，一名分管副镇长受到党内严重警告处分;临高县财政局一副局长违反组织人事纪律，擅自将其儿子的自筹人员工资办理为编内事业人员工资，受到党内警告和行政记过处分。
临高县有关负责人表示，通过查办案件有效解决了一批群众反映强烈的突出问题，严肃了党的纪律，震慑了腐败分子，教育了广大党员干部。(记者 林书喜 特约记者 陈朝辉)

description.hltext_display: Artistas, deportistas y personalidades distinguidos por el Gobierno
description.content:
En el marco del Bicentenario de la Nación, el Gobierno de Córdoba entrego la distinción “Brigadier General Juan Bautista Bustos”, un reconocimiento al aporte y trayectoria.
El premio Brigadier General Juan Bautista Bustos es “un merecido reconocimiento a aquellos cordobeses e instituciones que con su accionar a lo largo de su vida han trabajado por el progreso, el bienestar, el funcionamiento del sistema democrático en nuestra Córdoba y nos hacen sentir orgullosos de ser cordobés”, explicó el Gobernador Juan Schiaretti.
Los distinguidos con la medalla de plata fueron: Ana María Alfaro (Artista); Elvira Ceballos (Concertista); Carlos "La Mona" Jiménez (Cantante); Daniel Wellington (Deportista); Alfredo Leuco (Periodista); David Nalbandian (Deportista); Fabricio Oberto (Deportista); Daniel Salzano (Escritor); Clidy Suárez (Locutora); Jairo (Cantante); Claudio Orosz (Derechos Humanos); Martín Fresneda (Derechos Humanos); Emilia Ofellia Villares de D´Ambra (Derechos Humanos); Sonia Torres (Derechos Humanos); Agrupación H.I.J.O.S. (Derechos Humanos); Cadena 3 Argentina (Medio de Comunicación); Servicios de Radio y Televisión (Medio de Comunicación) y Canal 12 (Medio de Comunicación).
La entrega se realizó en el impactante Palacio Ferreyra, donde estuvieron presentes junto al Gobernador, su esposa Alejandra Vigo, el Vice Gobernador Campana y los ministros de Desarrollo Social, Juan Carlos Massei y de Gobierno, Carlos Caserio. Además de los secretarios de Inclusión Social y Equidad de Género y de Derechos Humanos, Raúl Sánchez y los presidentes de Agencia Córdoba Turismo, Gustavo Sánchez y de Deportes, Medardo Ligorria.
“Cada medallón está realizado en plata sellada 900, con un diámetro de 60 milímetros y un espesor de 3 milímetros, en su anverso se aprecia la imagen ecuestre del “Brigadier General Juan Bautista Bustos”, replica del monumento emplazado en el parque Sarmiento de la ciudad de Córdoba y personalizada en el reverso”, detallaron desde gobernación.

description.hltext_display: “รัน” ทำตัวไม่ถูกป๊ะ "กฤษณ์" ยันไม่ฉกแย่งจากอก "มาช่า"
description.content:
“รัน” ยันไม่ใช่มือที่ 3 ฉก “กฤษณ์” จาก “มาช่า” ควงลั้นลาเชียงใหม่ เผยไม่รู้จักฝ่ายชายเป็นการส่วนตัว ทั้งตนไม่ได้ไปเชียงใหม่เลย คาดคงเป็นคนหน้าคล้ายที่ดีเจตี๋ควงไป รับทำตัวไม่ถูกต้องป๊ะหน้าอีกฝ่าย หวั่นเป็นประเด็นไม่เลิก วอนจบเพราะข่าวทำตนเสียหาย
งานเข้าดาราสาว “รัน ณัทธมนกาญจน์ ศรีนิกรโชติ” อย่างจัง หลังมีคนตาดีระบุว่า เห็นเธอควงดีเจหน้าตี๋ “กฤษณ์ ศรีภูมิเศรษฐ์” ไปลั้นลาเที่ยวเชียงใหม่ หลังฝ่ายชายเพิ่งประกาศเลิกม่ายสาว “มาช่า วัฒนพานิช” อย่างเป็นทางการ ทำให้สาวรันเจอข้อหาเป็นมือที่ 3 ทันที และวันก่อนดาราสาวได้ไปร่วมงานเดียวกันกับดีเจหน้าตี๋ ในงานกิจกรรมเลี้ยงปีใหม่ให้กับทหาร 3 จังหวัดชายแดนภาคใต้ที่ได้รับบาดเจ็บ ที่รพ.พระมงกุฏฯ เลยทำให้ถูกจับตามองจากสื่อมากเป็นพิเศษว่า ทั้งคู่จะมีปฏิกิริยาต่อกันอย่างไร แต่ปรากฏต่างฝ่ายต่างทำเชิดใส่เหมือนมองไม่เห็นกันซะงั้น ผู้สื่อข่าวจึงไปสอบถามรันถึงความสัมพันธ์กับกฤษณ์ เจ้าตัวชี้แจงให้ฟังว่า
“รันทราบว่าเรามีข่าวด้วยกัน แต่ไม่ทราบว่าพี่เขามาร่วมงานด้วยกัน จะบอกว่ามันเป็นข่าวที่ไม่น่าจะมีมูลเลย เพราะรันไม่เคยไปเชียงใหม่กับพี่กฤษณ์ แค่เคยเจอกันที่งาน แล้วก็ไม่เคยรู้จักนอกจากการทำงานด้วยกันค่ะ สันนิษฐานว่าที่มีข่าวออกมาน่าจะเป็นวันที่รันไปช่วยขายไอศกรีมที่งาน EFM แล้วพี่เขาต้องไปร่วมงานอยู่แล้ว อาจจะเป็นตอนนั้นมั้งคะที่พี่เขาเดินเข้ามาคุยด้วยหน้าบูธ อาจจะเป็นภาพนั้นหรือเปล่า มีคนถ่ายภาพนั้นไปแล้วก็ไปสันนิษฐานว่า เฮ้ย...ไปเจอกันข้างนอกหรือเปล่า ซึ่งต้องบอกว่าไม่เคยเจอข้างนอกค่ะ เจอกันในงานแค่นั้นเอง”
“พอมีข่าวออกมาว่าเราไปเชียงใหม่ด้วยกัน ก็ยอมรับว่างงค่ะ จริงๆ ตอนแรกเห็นข่าวก็ไม่คิดว่ามันจะเป็นเรื่องเป็นราวอะไรขนาดนั้น คิดว่าสงสัยจะเป็นการเขียนแบบแซวเล่นๆ เพราะรันเคยโดนกรณีนี้มาแล้วครั้งหนึ่ง ไม่บอกแล้วกันว่าเป็นใคร แต่เป็นกรณีว่าเห็นรันไปงานกับพี่คนหนึ่ง ซึ่งเขาเพิ่งเลิกกับคนหนึ่งมา แต่สุดท้ายผลสรุปคือไม่ใช่รัน แต่ เป็นคนหน้าคล้าย รันก็ถือว่าโอเคไม่เป็นไร เพราะมันไม่ใช่อยู่แล้ว แต่ว่าครั้งนี้มันกลายเป็นเรื่องที่ไม่น่าจะเป็นเรื่องเลย เพราะไม่รู้จักกันเป็นการส่วนตัว”
“และจริงๆ รันไม่ได้ไปเชียงใหม่เลย ช่วงนี้รันอยู่กรุงเทพฯ แล้วก็มีไปทำงานที่ลำปาง แล้วก็ไปเชียงคาน แต่ไม่ได้ไปเชียงใหม่เลยแน่นอน คงจะเห็นใครที่หน้าคล้ายรันหรือเปล่า รันว่าถ้ามันไม่ใช่เรื่องจริง เดี๋ยวก็เงียบไปเอง แต่ว่าไม่อยากให้เป็นประเด็นขึ้นมา เพราะพี่เขาก็มีข่าวค่อนข้างแรงอยู่แล้ว รันว่าพี่กฤษณ์ก็คงอยากจบข่าวเรื่องผู้หญิง รันก็ไม่อยากให้เป็นข่าว เพราะพอมันเสีย เราก็เสียด้วย มันก็กลายเป็นมือที่สาม ต้องบอกเลยว่าไม่ใช่ค่ะ ไม่รู้จักพี่กฤษณ์เป็นการส่วนตัวค่ะ”
ยอมรับหลังมีข่าวเกิดขึ้นทำให้วางตัวไม่ถูกกับ “ดีเจกฤษณ์” เพราะหวั่นเป็นประเด็นต่อเนื่องไม่จบสักที
“ก่อนหน้านี้รันเจอพี่เขาที่งาน ก็คุยกันนะ ก็สวัสดี แต่ว่าพอมีข่าวขึ้นมา รันก็เลยไม่รู้จะต้องทำตัวยังไง ถึงจะไม่ให้มันกลายเป็นเรื่องต่อไป ถ้าเกิดเราเดินไปสวัสดีเนี่ย มันจะกลายเป็นประเด็นต่อหรือเปล่า พี่ๆ จะถ่ายรูปกันไปแล้วจะกลายเป็นเรื่องต่อไป รันก็อยากจะให้มันจบ และรันเชื่อว่าพี่กฤษณ์ก็คงไม่อยากจะให้มีข่าวเรื่องนี้หรอก”

description.hltext_display: British Polythene Industries PLC Pre close trading update
description.content: TIDMBPI RNS Number : 3966Y British Polythene Industries PLC 22 December 2010 22 December 2010 PRE CLOSE PERIOD TRADING UPDATE & RENEGOTIATION OF BANKING FACILITIES Prior to entering the close period ahead of the preliminary results for the year to 31 December 2010, British Polythene Industries PLC has issued an update on current trading. "Trading remains consistent with that described in our Interim Management Statement of 15 November and we, therefore, expect our results for the year to be within the range of current market expectations. Raw material costs and availability continue to be an issue and our suppliers are seeking further increases for January. We have agreed new banking facilities of GBP70 million to replace our GBP57.5 million revolving credit facilities which expire in November 2011 and certain short term facilities. Of the new facilities GBP55 million will expire early in 2015 and the balance will expire in 2014. Our total facilities including asset finance and overdrafts remain in excess of GBP100 million. The preliminary results for the year ended 31 December 2010 will be announced on 7 March 2011." Enquiries: British Polythene Industries Cameron McLatchie, Chairman PLC 01475 501000 John Langlands, Chief British Polythene Industries Executive PLC 01475 501000 Tim Spratt/Nicola Biles Financial Dynamics 0207 831 3113 This information is provided by RNS The company news service from the London Stock Exchange END TSTUAONRROAUUAA
